If you ask that question, people get to choose their own answer. But this isn't what the debate is about. Climate change is going to cause a crisis with grave economic consequences that will be felt for the next decades, decades, decades, if we wait long enough. That problem is going to have to be fixed, and it's going to be hard. I'm not going to pretend it's easy. I do, however, support the need for the government to spend on climate change. A couple of things. First, some people don't quite grasp the difference between climate and weather, and climate and the weather of the future. Second, the "fiscal cliff" will hurt in the short term, but not in the long term. A couple of things have to happen first if the U.S. is to survive a future downturn: Cut the deficits Reduce the debt There's no need to do anything big like raising taxes because the budget problems will be solved if they're done in the short term. We just need to balance the budget. 3) The "fiscal cliff" is bad news because it shows a lack of leadership It's good news that the economy is not growing at a rate we should expect, because a growth-stagnant economy is a sign of too much slack in the economy. It doesn't matter whether the slack consists solely of slack in the labor market, or if there's slack in the market in general. Let me give an example. Let's pretend that at a given time of year, the prices for things like eggs and butter are at levels that are higher than they are this time last year. You know what's going to happen? Demand for those things will be stronger than supply. If there's less slack in the economy, then you don't have a recession of the sort we're seeing. But if there are slack, then demand for things like butter and eggs will eventually crash. So there's plenty of slack in the economy. The market might well adjust to the higher prices, but that's a temporary event. That is the situation we're in. We'd still know that our economy was on a downward trajectory if we were to compare it to other countries around the world. But we don't see it that way, because we aren't getting any signals from the markets that something needs to change. This isn't simply a function of insufficient demand — we can easily compensate for shortages in goods like butter and eggs by raising their prices. It's a function of the fact that we don't even have a reasonable sense of how slack there actually is. There's a lesson there. Countries with more slack are going to have to think about doing something about it. It can't just be a matter of waiting for it to show. As to whether it can be done, that's still up in the air. 4) The "fiscal cliff" shows that Republicans and Democrats don't have much confidence in the economy Well, we can't wait around for the markets to adjust. But not doing so will just cause us to miss the economy — it could also lead to the markets continuing to struggle through the rest of the year, possibly increasing the risk of a crash. There's

What is it? It's a video game that's a combination of a game, a movie theater and a nightclub. Where can I play it? The game can be played on the web. What's the difference between a movie theater and a game? The theater and the game are made of the same medium (i.e., screens). Movies and games are two completely different forms of entertainment and one is interactive, while the other is non-interactive. The game is primarily an event that features entertainment. Movies are an event that can occur in nearly any venue – any time of the day or any night. Is the game like other game consoles like PS2 and XBOX? The first games to use the "motion-capture" technology were the first "motion-capture" games. Motion-capture technologies are used to add "interactivity" to the game by creating a 3D model of how your character moves. These technologies work by using infrared or other electromagnetic technology to detect a player's movements and the game must use this information to animate the character. These games were designed to allow for more realism than games of the time, but they also created an opportunity for game developers to create completely new genres of games that we now call "action" games, "fighting games", "adventure games", "role-playing games", and so on. These were not created for entertainment – these games were designed to entertain you. What makes this game special? There is a lot we can learn from watching a movie. For example, you can see when a character makes eye contact or turns his or her head to indicate something. Watching a movie also provides us with new tools that we can use to make a product. Video games can teach us a lot about how to create a great game. What will be in it? There will be a game called "World of Warcraft". It will allow players to create a character and then explore the world using the in-game interface. They can do so by exploring different parts of the "world", leveling up, obtaining items, and completing quests. Some of the aspects that will be in the game include: "realism", "choice", "embellishment", "elevation", "action", "immersion," "dynamic" (e.g., a battle might be played out in a different way than in an action movie). How do we play it? On the web: You can play it through a browser at youtube.com Playing it on your favorite device: You can play Warcraft through your app Playing it on your favorite device or with a controller: You can play through your own home or office computer or phone. It's a social experience. What's the game going to cost? It will be sold through Blizzard for $80. What's your current goal? We don't have an amount of money in mind. We know it will take at least a few thousand dollars to make this game so it's the minimum we need to get started. Who will play it? The game will be made for gamers. What's the team like? We are about eight people from diverse backgrounds. We have come together because we are passionate about games and we want to make a game that can really entertain people. What was your inspiration for the game? There were many inspirations for Warcraft that shaped the game. Our primary inspiration is the films the game is based on, but we also have some elements of real history in game. We started out by thinking about fantasy fantasy war games, then we started to think about what kind of game we could make that we could see ourselves playing in real life. In that process we came up with a concept known as World of Warcraft and we had a lot of fun playing around with it and playing with the technology we have. Why were you interested in this project? With World of Warcraft, we wanted to make a game that allows people to explore and experience the game the way that they might have seen it presented in the films. We love the mythology and the world of Warcraft was the ideal game to take our inspiration and apply it to a video game form. In addition to a great gameplay experience it will be great to make a game that is based off real game technology instead of having to wait until 20 years from now for something to be done. Where can I buy Warcraft? You can purchase Warcraft from the Blizzard web site. To see a short video, watch the trailer from this month's BlizzCon:

Greetings Saviors!We hope you're all well and enjoying your weekend! The team is hard at work on the 0.9.13 patch, and we would love to share this update with you guys. We did not include a full list of changes, but here are some of the top highlights:In the event of bugs or crashes, please contact our Support Desk which is located in the Support tab of the Community menu. It is also a good idea to check the Known Issues thread in the discussion forum which has a comprehensive list of known issues. If you are unable to find an solution to your problem, please be sure to post in the bug report category in the discussion forum and include the log files. If you are unable to post in the bug report category, please understand that we are unable to help you directly, but will be working to try to fix any issues that are reported.Included into this patch are two bug fixes that were also in the Closed Beta.As there have been a number of reports regarding crashes or strange behavior, we thought we would share with you how we're working towards fixing these issues. For our part, a few of us are testing different options - some of which are temporary, some of which may not even survive the next Beta update to the game which may introduce completely new bugs. As more information is available, we will hopefully be able to update you to help you resolve your issue.

How did a bunch of computer nerds accidentally turn into super heroes and become the greatest supervillains and heroes the world has ever seen? In this video, director Matt Berenson breaks down how they did it. This is a long one, so keep in mind there are spoilers. As many of you know, the comic book villain The Green Goblin was created as an amalgamation of several characters and ideas, including a scientist, his assistant, and a spy. He's never truly been explained in great detail, not because of the character, but because of the character's existence, and I'm pretty sure that's why there hasn't been a Green Goblin movie yet. Advertisement In the comics, the character came in the form of a scientist who got out of trouble in the 1940s, and ended up marrying the woman who had created him. That's who he then impregnated, and then created some sort of hybrid monster from that. He didn't really do any real plotting or writing for his own character, and just sort of went about his normal work day with the Green Goblin. The whole thing was pretty much completely ripped off and made more ridiculous when a comic book publisher was hired by Stan Lee to create the real story. The real story was that the Green Goblin had just graduated from college and was working as a writer in the Marvel offices. He didn't realize he was an interdimensional being from a parallel world (like the other comics villains, actually) until he was arrested and brought in front of the grand jury by the government. He learned that Spider-Man, the greatest hero of all time, had just become a hero of justice. He decided it was his duty to use the power of his Goblin ring on this person. In Spider-Man, Peter Parker became the first hero to actually fight a supervillain the government never even knew existed. And that's when he discovered that the Green Goblin was actually a real character who had lived in the Marvel offices for years. They had decided to give him a new name just to be ironic. Advertisement A year later they came up with a way to bring him back and he was reborn as a superhero called The Green Goblin. He became one of the top super-spies of his time, but then his wife died, so he went to her grave without her blessing and started a new life. As a superhero, he became obsessed with making sure Spider-Man was arrested for his crimes. Finally, it became clear he had no choice but to go full-on supervillain again. This time he teamed up with other supervillains to stop Spider-Man. It was at this time that Spider-Man went insane and started doing a lot of crime in his own comic book. And the Goblin was the one who was responsible for that. Advertisement He took a lot of punishment from Spidey, but eventually Spider-Man's mind was destroyed, and the Spider-Tracers began tracking him down and capturing him. After the government finally caught up with the Green Goblin, the Green Goblin decided it would be ironic to do an arrest so close to the end of his own life. He decided to escape from prison using his new alias: Doctor Octopus. And here's where things get pretty weird, because in the comic books he uses his "Octopus tentacles" to create a prison and then he sets a trap for Spidey. It's like Spider-Man went to a comic book convention and suddenly his favorite villains started becoming his friends. Advertisement The Goblin has the power of Spider-Man's nemesis the Green Goblin, but his real powers came off as a few "dancing with the stars" and super-speed tricks. So the Green Goblin's true power was in manipulating the minds of others and using them as puppets to his will. The Green Goblin was basically like all the other villains you'd find in the Avengers movies. He used his power to make life difficult for Spider-Man, but eventually the two villains got into an epic fight where the two super heroes destroyed each other. After that they put a "trap" out that they thought would defeat the Green Goblin. When it was destroyed, the Green Goblin escaped and ran to another dimension, where his powers were so powerful he decided Spider-Man was the problem and he took out the human race. Advertisement Here's the thing: the Green Goblin did not actually destroy the human race. Even though Doc Ock destroyed the Fantastic Four, Spider-Man and the rest of the humans were still alive. If the Green Goblin had destroyed the other dimension, we would never have been shown the Fantastic Four get back together. Instead, the Green Goblin and Doc Ock ended up in a third dimension where they were forced to use each other's brain waves to communicate, but it was so powerful the Green Goblin destroyed the entire universe and all the

Dry-Dry All the flavors of the outdoors are made at Dry-Dry, a new food-and-wine retailer offering products prepared with love and care. With three locations in New York City (Bowery locations), Los Angeles (Westside locations) and Washington, D.C., Dry-Dry offers an ever-growing selection of food and wine through an inviting, inviting, and relaxed environment, featuring a variety of natural and fresh products in both traditional and fun packaging.

The U.S. Navy's new amphibious transport dock (LPD-17) is almost in production and some U.S. cities are considering bidding for contracts to house its crew. The LPD-17 is based on shipbuilder General Dynamics Electric Boat's USS New Orleans-class LPD amphibious assault ships, and is to be delivered in 2018. General Dynamic has already contracted with one shipyard in Alabama for up to eight more LPD-17's -- but a second shipyard has yet to be selected, and many US cities are talking to shipyards about hosting them. "Some cities are bidding for the first few deliveries to be delivered of the LPD-17s. This will have tremendous logistical effects on our local communities," said Lt. General Chris Kolender, chief of naval operations for U.S. Northern Command. "We're looking for communities where we can deliver the LPDs and take advantage, if they're able, of the local workforce," he added. The amphibious assault ship is capable of carrying a complement of 7,700 Marines and 1,350 soldiers on a long deployment. The ships have been under construction for a number of years with General Dynamics Electric Boat finishing the first three ships in 2011. General Dynamics Electric Boat is working on the first three LPD-17s for the U.S. Navy. There were no bids yet for those services. The shipyard in Mobile, Alabama, is also in the running for the future order -- where the company is also building a second LPD-17 -- though Kolender said Mobile's proposal has yet to be considered. In fact, there's no guarantee that this second shipyard will even be selected to become a "homeport" for the U.S. Navy's amphibious assault ships. The U. S. Navy will continue to operate the New Orleans-class attack ships as normal. The next two LPD-17s were expected to be delivered by late 2016, however that project is now projected to ship "late 2017," according to Kolender. General Dynamics Electric Boat announced plans to build the LPD-17 and other amphibious assault ships in 2010. The first three vessels would then have reached full service around 2021 -- but General Dynamics Electric Boat recently canceled development of the Navy's LPD-class amphibious transports, citing a lack of financing from the government. The LPD-17 amphibious assault ships will cost more than $4 billion dollars apiece. General Dynamics Electric Boat is also building the USS Milwaukee-class LPD-17 and the USS New York-class LPD-26 for the same Navy.

The FBI has on four occasions in the last year received and processed Freedom of Information Act requests for information about the Clinton Foundation. Four different judges have found that none of the public information requests was "sufficiently specific to constitute a FOIA exemption," according to the Associated Press. Yet the FBI continues its routine practice of releasing little information about the Clinton Foundation. The FBI has been under fire for months about its handling of former Secretary Clinton's emails. In March, it recommended no charges be brought against Clinton for lying under oath at a congressional hearing, which she later denied. The Clinton emails scandal also continues to hamper the presidential campaign of Sen. Bernie Sanders. The Clinton Foundation is one of the biggest contributors to the Clinton Foundation and has attracted criticism for accepting foreign donations while Hillary Clinton governed the State Department. Despite its ongoing problems, the Clinton Foundation still lists Clinton as a trustee and lists two of its largest donors on its website as CGI (Conference of Presidents of Major American Jewish Organizations) and Deutsche Bank. The Clinton Foundation is also mired in an unrelated lawsuit related to its acceptance of donations from governments for projects in the Middle East. The foundation agreed to pay the State Department $10 million after revelations that some of the money came from government contractors, but the State Department did not press the issue, instead asking only for a pledge of $500,000 to reimburse agency salaries. In a letter to the attorney general last year, the Foundation promised to refrain from receiving foreign governmental donations, but did not commit to not take government money from future projects. The Clinton Foundation received two separate FOIA requests regarding its foreign donations over the course of 2015. But the FBI withheld information in at least one case. In May 2015, the FOIA requester went through the request line by line, seeking information about the Clinton Foundation's ties to countries such as Algeria and Saudi Arabia. Each of the requests were denied. In June 2015, a different FOIA requester sought information about the Clinton Foundation's operations around the global AIDS crisis. This FOIA request, too, was denied. In December 2015, another federal FOIA requester made a request related to the Clinton Foundation's activities around the global humanitarian crisis in the Darfur region of Sudan. It was denied. The FOIA requester then sought further information within the agency that seemed to shed some light of the allegations against the Clinton Foundation, and the FBI denied the request again. But this time, the judge noted that the FBI had acknowledged it had received the requests, albeit just once. "It is not plausible to believe that this FBI agent did not see or receive the FOIA requests," wrote Judge Andrew Hanen. "Each of the FOIA requests is specific enough to constitute a FOIA exception. In all, four judges have found that none of these FOIA requests is 'sufficiently specific to constitute a FOIA exemption.'" The Associated Press reports: The FBI received each of the four requested records from the Clinton Foundation. In three cases, an FBI agent noted there were insufficient details or documents, or both, to determine whether the information could be turned over. But the FBI did not explain why its agents found these cases insufficient when they had previously cited them as complete. The FBI did not immediately return our request for comment. The FBI has repeatedly come under fire in recent months for its handling of Clinton emails amid the presidential campaign. Former FBI agents have said that the agency was too slow to release documents related to its investigation into Clinton's email server or questions about whether she lied in Congress after she testified under oath that she never sent or received emails that were marked classified. It seems to be that the FBI has not only violated Freedom of Information Act, but perhaps it has breached its own policies, as well.

It takes very little to drive a vehicle off the road, but when you combine it with extreme weather, you're bound to wind up in a crash. It can happen even if you don't feel anything unusual; and while it can happen to the best of us, it's more often a result of bad decisions, not natural laws. Whether your car is running great or not will not make the difference to how it ends up. Check your insurance company's policy and see what its minimum coverage is if you're hit by another driver that you know is driving safely and within their limits. What is covered? Your policy will pay up to $100,000 for damage to your vehicles and/or personal property, plus any medical bills and loss or damage to your personal belongings. How much should I be covered? The minimum coverage is $25,000, and many policy-holders in Canada can save up to 30 per cent on their monthly insurance cost, according to insuranceQuotes.ca. If you're hit, you can ask your driver-side coverage to cover more of the cost, and more of you should. But you may have to wait because insurance companies work on a 'gross loss ratio' that they use in determining how much they cover the average loss of a claim – which is usually $25,000. Many insurers don't do that – like all Canadian insurance companies – they only take into account a driver's actual vehicle and driver when calculating their insurance premiums – not a passenger carrying your gear, for example. So you might get more coverage if you have someone that is riding with you because you could be considered as the vehicle carrying the items. The policy might not go up, however, if you have a driver that isn't wearing a seat belt, or if your driver isn't properly equipped – in which case your driver-side coverage will be less. How much you might save can vary according to your vehicle's condition when it was struck. It depends on how much damage the car sustained, the driver's condition when the incident occurred and any other factors, which could include your insurer's claim procedure. What's in it for car insurers? The average per-centage premium difference between what a consumer pays for their car insurance and what they are expected to pay will vary according to age, gender and personal circumstances. For instance, a female driver who has a five-year-old Honda Civic but no insurance and earns $21,000 per year will pay more to get a similar-size, newer Honda Accord. The difference would depend on what type of insurance you have and what policy is on your plate, and how long it's been since you paid your last premium. On the other hand, a male driver with a $50-million-plus home would pay less than the insurer would be comfortable with paying, especially if they have no insurance. As a driver with no insurance, you may have to pay less because they pay to cover your accident, which means they don't have to pay your medical bills. Here's a breakdown of what to expect when you drive – and what to get. Insurance company policies: what it means to drive Generally, if you have a comprehensive and collision policy, you shouldn't have to worry about going through anything more complicated than the minimum required by law if you get into an accident while driving legally. However, if you don't have any insurance, then it's an extra step you'll have to go through in order to get some help from your automobile insurance company's policies to recover the costs of your accident. The cost of damage to your vehicle and your personal belongings can vary in many other ways. For instance, a large dent in your vehicle may cost much less to repair than if you're driving an older model that you didn't think through properly the way you parked. That's why it's always a good idea to get a quote from several insurance companies to make sure the cost you're paying meets your needs. Here's a more detailed look at what the cost of collisions could mean for those who own cars they drive every day: Car collision When a driver takes a vehicle off the road they increase the risk that it will roll onto its side, or roll out onto a roadway in a manner that could hurt many other drivers. When this occurs, the potential for a serious injury is often much greater – especially in a situation where vehicles can be seen approaching from more than one direction. Collisions with cars and trucks are typically the most serious type of collisions and are the single leading cause of fatalities and injuries for children and women between the ages of 3 and 35 years of age. In order to decrease the risk from collision, you must reduce the risk of one or more of these situations resulting in a

It seems that this issue of the NUT has the support of the whole organisation. The NUT has set up a website http://www.numbersunion.org.uk/help-us-put-a-stop-to-this-abuse/. I am asking that the NUT puts this issue to the Members ballot this autumn. A public vote would be a stronger way of making the decision. If there were no votes in October, then the union could simply ignore the whole issue.  I have not seen what the reasons are for not voting or having the issue put forward to Members (how else was I supposed to know about it?).  I don't believe there is a need to take the matter to the courts. The NUT is the elected governing body for the NUM. What the NUT needs to do instead is to look into ways of putting a halt to the abusive and racist incidents and of dealing with those responsible for them - the NUT has a duty to investigate and put an end to it.  If a vote is not put forward this autumn then I would like to send a message to those who have spoken out. The union does still have your support but I think that the NUT has some work to do to try and address how we are failing the majority of its own members.  I would like to ask that all parties should put their best efforts into attempting to stop this abuse from happening again.

The best thing to know about the American Dream — even in a Donald Trump administration — will be that it is neither a myth nor far-fetched. The American Dream as the premise of economics — a society in which all aspire to become better off despite material differences — is almost never an abstraction. In many cases, it's a reality. But even with all the talk about equality, the American Dream — or even its opposite — remains a hard sell in most of the developed world because it comes with strings attached. People who are born into the upper, middle and upper classes are, on average, more fortunate than those who are born out of those social classes. Their birthright of the American Dream means they may not necessarily succeed if they succeed. Those fortunate kids who do succeed generally are rewarded with higher levels of income for the rest of their working lives. That dynamic is unlikely to change in the coming years even under the most egalitarian government in recent history. Consider that the U.K.'s Conservative Party government just enacted a regressive tax plan to fund a massive new public-sector pension plan that, among other things, would boost top-earning retirees to nearly £300,000 from £240,000 ($400,000). Similarly, the Netherlands' new Social Democratic government is implementing a similar, if considerably smaller, plan. Even the most progressive nations in the world — those that, according to the U.N., have among the best human rights records — tend to tax people at higher rates to cover their public-sector pensions. "When you raise taxes people just save less." In order to create a pension program for those in the higher middle class, the Netherlands and U.K. must fund it with higher taxes than most of their citizens pay today — as high, in the US, as about 37 percent (about double the national rate). In order to fund the new program, they plan to raise taxes on a larger cohort of taxpayers, while at the same time slashing personal income taxes from 13 percent in the Netherlands to 10 percent in the U.K. This is the problem with the American Dream. The U.S. is home to the most unequal society in the history of the world, but it's also home to the most unequal society in the developed world. If a person's economic opportunity is determined in part by where they were born — even if that circumstance may have changed over the course of their lifetime — where they were born can shape their future even more than where they are now. The U.S. has always boasted some of the most generous programs to assist people in getting to where they want to be. As recently as the late 1960s in the U.S., the government paid millions of poor students directly in the form of Pell Grants, which covered tuition for a four-year college program. Today, however, student loans that have a ballooning interest rate make it prohibitively expensive to attend college for the poor. Indeed, in order to attend a public college in the U.S. at all, a poor person must save $26,000 for four years, or $54,000 over 25 years. The average American family's net wealth is $73,000, while it's just $23,000 for a family headed by someone making below the poverty line. Yet one of the U.S. government's biggest funding priorities — the American Opportunity Tax Credit (which offers people up to $2,500 in government money per year once the student graduates with an associate's degree, and up to $4,000 once they graduate with a bachelor's degree) — goes mostly to the middle and upper classes. If a person's economic opportunity is determined in part by where they were born in the U.S., where they live now can shape their future even more than where they are now. "The idea that you would be born to a wealthy family — that you will be a billionaire in your 50s — is certainly a myth," Yale professor William Julius Wilson told me. In fact, a great many people who are born into middle-class families wind up becoming "the poorest half" of the poor, according to the National Foundation for Educational Research. And while there is a good chance that someone born into poverty might succeed as an entrepreneur — a good percentage of the U.S. population is still struggling with poverty — even if they don't, someone born into the upper middle class is virtually certain to become a multimillionaire. "If you're born into an upper middle class family you almost always will be a multimillionaire," Wilson said. "If you're born into a lower middle class family you likely will not." This inequality is not an abstract idea that exists in a theoretical realm, or simply an issue of poor people on drugs or rich people on drugs. It is not a matter of wealth created in a bubble. A study published this month by the Pew Charitable Trusts found that the wealthiest

If you want a good laugh, just look at Facebook's privacy settings. A new video shows the social media giant doing what it does best — turning on the privacy setting that says you are allowed to read what folks who don't know you are reading. Then look. It's been a busy couple of weeks for Facebook, which is being sued by the U.S. Attorney's office in Los Angeles over a program that reportedly tracked people's Internet use without their knowledge. The two companies are in some ways similar. Facebook has an enormous user base, but does so with its social network being as accessible as it is. "I can see if you have the 'Notify me with updates' on, that is quite telling," says the video. "They know when you have your phone on, they know when you were going to coffee today." It then plays a clip where Facebook lets you change your privacy settings. The settings say, "Your privacy is important to us and what you do online can impact your friends and relationships, your job and your family. You have the power to control your information and Facebook is here to help." The YouTube video ends with an ad for Privacy Switch, which is a new service that lets you do the same thing and control what people who don't know you can see. Forbes reported earlier this week on the lawsuit by the U.S. Attorney General that accused Facebook of violating the Federal Records Act. They claim that during the 2012 U.S. presidential campaign, a pro-Presidential candidate named John Huntsman Jr. used Facebook to share information about his fundraising efforts while he was being vetted. Facebook says that "in a very small selection of the cases identified on the Justice Department's website — less than 1% of the more than 800,000 federal criminal prosecutions prosecuted during the last decade — charges were filed based on information revealed to the public through our information practices."

By Andrew Burnes We've all heard of graphics cards with their impressive capabilities, but few have ever experienced one that blows away the competition, even from those very same platforms. The new AMD Radeon RX Vega, which can be purchased for the very affordable premium of $499 or a mere $399, is one of those products, and it can blow past almost anybody's expectations thanks to some seriously impressive performance from the 4GB of HBM memory running at an incredible 4.20 TFLOPS of processing power (double the previous generation's Radeon RX Vega Frontier Edition at 3.8 TFLOPS). The RX Vega 64 and 36GB of 3GB of GDDR5 memory on board are capable of 12-16.29 Gbps of peak bandwidth, as explained in our earlier feature. Those massive HBM stacks are so dense that AMD claims the Vega 64 can deliver more performance than a single GeForce GPU. Noteworthy is that a card running a single Radeon Vega 64 is more than capable of gaming at 1440p and 4K resolutions at medium and high settings, with smooth frame rates, low input latency, and zero perceptible stuttering. The RX Vega 64 is the company's first graphics card on a dual-GPU solution, but it doesn't make use of two, but two of AMD's next-gen Vega GPUs. This model packs 16GB of HBM memory running at 8Gbps and a pair of stacked High Bandwidth Memory chips, clocked at 6GHz, working to feed 32GB of more HBM memory up to 64GB. A single HBM2 stack is able to deliver an impressive 4.20 TFLOPS, and we've seen the same clock speeds on a single Vega 64, but it still pales in comparison to the full 64GB capacity needed by the RX Vega graphics card. So, does such enormous memory capacity mean more data is needed for processing? It does, and with the RX Vega 64 AMD claims its memory can be used as cache for graphics workloads, and that doesn't change when it comes to how we use games and VR experience. The AMD Vega 64 graphics card will be the first graphics card to offer dedicated GDDR5 memory capable of playing VR as VR Ready, which means it can reliably produce stable frame rates without a hitch. That's something that AMD claims will be important when it comes to the Rift launch. In case you're not familiar, a VR Ready graphics card is able to sustain a 60 frames per second refresh and is able to deliver smooth performance no matter what the resolution. We do have one feature on the RX Vega 64 that we haven't seen yet but will be sure to bring you more of in our full Vega Gaming launch coverage on PC Gamer next week. The Vega 64 Graphics Card Comes In Two Versions To make things even more appealing, the AMD Vega Graphics cards come in two different versions. We got our hands on the new Vega 56 (which is AMD branding for their new flagship cards) at AMD's booth to share with you, so you can see for yourself what's new and improved for such an incredible price point. This card delivers a premium price point that'll put you very close to the VR Ready and VR Ready 2.0 cards at that price point, and it features a custom waterblock with RGB LEDs which can be controlled via the RGB LED Strip and Fan controller. To top things off, you get dual BIOSes, a Dual-X Cooler design, and plenty of other features. There is one problem, however. For a card that's so well-priced, AMD has dropped the resolution from the Vega 56 to the Vega 64. It's not that we're complaining; that card isn't exactly impressive, as we showed you in our Vega Frontier Edition review, which is powered by a new Vega 64 graphics card. There are two reasons for this: As the RX Vega 64 sports a dual-GPU design, you need two graphics cards instead of just one. If you use one of AMD's high-refresh and high-resolution monitors, the Vega 64 is unable to provide the smooth frame rates that you need from VR-ready, VR Ready 2.0 graphics cards. The resolution that it can support is 1920x1080, or at least 1920x1080 at 120Hz. With the AMD FreeSync feature enabled, the monitor can only push 20-bit color, so the Vega 64 needs to upscale games down to a higher resolution in order to support the high refresh rates required by the RX Vega 56. When the RX Vega 64 comes to market in late December 2017, both variants will sell for under $500, so it will be interesting to see which features AMD and its partners make use of in this new model. At this price point, it seems as though the performance of the RX Vega 64 is just too enticing. We'll be bringing you all of our impressions on when the launch lands on Monday, November 28th, so stay tuned! In the meantime, if you

KABUL (Reuters) - U.S. President Donald Trump's order to ban immigrants and refugees for 90 days and all visitors for 120 days has caused widespread concern in Afghanistan but at least one local government expects more donations in response to the ban. U.S. President Donald Trump walks with Secretary of State Rex Tillerson (R) and Secretary of Homeland Security John Kelly (L) as they meet with Afghanistan's President Ashraf Ghani in the Oval Office of the White House in Washington, U.S., January 27, 2017. REUTERS/Jim Bourg Afghan Prime Minister Shahid Khaqan Abbasi said the U.S. executive order did not impact the country politically because most Afghan people did not like it and were in favor of a better economic relationship with the United States that would help Afghan forces. "The Americans know it, but the Afghans ... are very thankful for every gesture of goodwill from America," Abbasi told Reuters at an informal news conference with his foreign minister. "I hope it will be reflected on our donation of aid, I hope America will continue to offer the support and the cooperation towards Afghanistan," he said. The ban was due to start on Thursday but was put on hold when Trump's administration was told last week that a federal court in Washington state had put the ban on hold. Several U.S Senators, including Republican Bob Corker, a Tennessee senator, and Democrat Chris Coons, a Delaware senator, said the administration should quickly re-instate the travel ban and get the courts to overturn an earlier decision that allowed Trump to put the ban on hold. The White House did not respond immediately to a request for comment on whether it would revise the ban, given that the appeal of the March court order was upheld. Trump signed the order on Friday after making the case in a speech at a military academy in Florida. He said the move was needed to improve vetting and national security after a failed attempt earlier this year by Washington to send in tens of thousands of extra troops to fight insurgents, including members of the Haqqani network. The ban applies indefinitely to most immigrants from Iraq, Iran, Libya, Somalia, Sudan, Syria and Yemen. It also suspends the refugee program for 120 days. Abbasi said the ban should not affect the Afghan people who were not citizens or had permanent resident rights in the United States, or the people who had entered the United States as refugees. He said the government had not received any complaints from American citizens. He said he was happy that a court had said a 90-day ban on immigrants could not go into effect unless it can be justified with good reasons. "Even if I disagree, it is better than the alternative, which is the ban on entering Afghanistan at all, for a long period of time," he said In another sign of the international criticism and concern this ban has caused, the German foreign ministry summoned an Afghan ambassador to express objections to the order. U.S. Secretary of State Rex Tillerson had expressed concern about the ban last week. [nL2N1O24Q5] Washington accused the government of Kabul of harboring militants and the Afghan government had made clear it had no intention of doing so. On Thursday, Afghan security forces conducted a raid to free a militant leader. "It is extremely regrettable that the Afghan government continues to harbor terrorist elements. And so all efforts are on our side to counter that," U.S. State Department spokeswoman Heather Nauert said. U.S. Marine General Joseph Dunford, chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, said the ban would not affect efforts to combat ISIS, the militant group also known as ISIS or ISIL, which has been fighting Western forces in Afghanistan for years and is a bitter enemy of the Taliban. Some countries will take less of a hit from the ban than others, he said, adding that the United States would continue to focus its efforts on ISIS's "core" regions in Syria and Iraq.

The most notable feature of the 2017 Toyota 86 is that it's a three-door sedan. This means it's an SUV, but it's actually an affordable compact car for most people as well. That's not to say that this model doesn't have some unique features (which are impressive), but just because it's a three-door doesn't mean you can't make it into a wagon by swapping the doors and the rear seats. How To Make An 86 Mini Wagon  The key to making an 86 mini wagon is going the off-roader route first and then making an SUV out of it; however, it doesn't have to have a hardtop roof. In your attempt to make a minivan, you'll need to do exactly what you would do for a wagon: get rid of any non-essential parts from the wagon model, such as an SUV engine, seats, or mirrors. Some parts were left in order to keep the price down, but some more expensive parts were tossed in as well, such as the gas tank, air conditioner, and brake rotors. Toyota says that the engine was left for two reasons. First, it's one more item you can remove if you want to convert your mini wagon into a wagon. Second, the engine isn't necessary (because it's a small engine, and mini wagons are actually just compact crossover vehicles) and it would be a pain to swap out the engine because no other vehicle can use it. The most common changes made to the mini wagons are the front bumper, side skirt covers, door panels, and floor mats; all of these can be taken off with a little effort. You'll need to find a place with a strong back rubber/rubberized surface, as these will break off quickly when getting them off. Other parts you're better off keeping are the front wheel drive, rear hub, and rear bumper. After getting the parts off, you're going to need to trim off the back tire so you can fit the spare tire under it; otherwise, your new mini wagon will have a flat tire while driving around town. You could also skip some of this stuff and replace these parts yourself, but why would you do that? To find the spare tire you'll need to get a wheel locker on your way to work. Then pick it up in a parking lot in which to work. This is important so the tire has plenty of room for you to put it. Before starting a mini wagon build, I highly recommend finding a mini wagon which already has some modifications done. This will save you a lot of money and headaches. You need to find a mini wagon that has been sitting around for a while. Look at its interior, its interior condition, its tires and paint, and maybe even its engine. You're looking for something that's already been well maintained. If the minivan has all of the above, it means it has one or more of the following things wrong: Tires that don't match the wheel Tires that are too worn Tires that aren't the right diameter or size Paint that's flaking off If you find any of these things, it will be a good indication that the mini wagon has some other issue. You'll notice some of these issues in other mini wagons as well, and they'll go away once you get rid of the parts for the mini wagon to make a regular wagon: Tires that are too worn Tires that are too small Tires that are off Tires that don't match the wheel Tires that are too new Tires that aren't the right diameter or size Paint that is flaking off You'll notice that some of these items can make the mini wagons better looking, but it'll increase the cost of the mini wagon. You'll get more value out of the mini wagons with the correct accessories on it. Keep tabs on these things in your mini wagon so you can sell it if they turn out to be a bad investment. How To Convert A Mini Wagon Into A Mini Sedan You'll need to take the off-roader and run it through some modifications, but the most important step of taking a mini wagon and turning it into a minivan is to give it the big door. This can be achieved by changing the roof, or by cutting part of the body panel. The easiest way to change the roof on a mini wagon is to take it off and then replace the door with a small, flat panel panel or a small plastic panel. Just be very careful to not cut into the side of the door or into the plastic panel to put in the new door, as you don't want to shatter it. A more expensive and time consuming way to change the roof is to break it into a new

RICHMOND is a rare commodity in today's world, with a passionate fan base and a passionate player base too. In my five years of attending, I can count the number of times I have encountered an angry Richmond supporter on one hand. And I'm a diehard football supporter too — a lifelong Tigers supporter and a lifelong A-League fan. So when I came back from Sunday's 1-0 win over Adelaide, a game at which Richmond fans booed their own players on multiple fronts, the first thing I realised was how lucky I was to have witnessed an event such as this in person. How did Richmond's players react? media_camera Fans turned their anger on Richmond's home supporters ... The most common response by players to jeers was to give a quick wave of the hand. The next two reactions were to laugh, which often made the loudest noise. When I spoke to Richmond's David Astbury about the booing, he said he did not get why it happened. He said he had asked himself why this happened. "I looked at the crowd on the way off and their faces ... they looked at me," Astbury said. "So I asked a couple of them. They said they were just upset their team got booed. "They were just disappointed, but, honestly, why on earth would they boo at me?" What's a Richmond fan to do? It's no surprise that Richmond is home to an intense, passionate fan base. They've not won a single premiership since 2007 and have won only two finals appearances in that time. So they expect a certain level of player performance and on Sunday that disappointment was clear. Some fans were loud, but this is a football ground and a football crowd. So a couple of Richmond players got up and waved their fists in the air or shook their heads while the players on the field were trying to put things back in perspective. Many supporters were very angry and took to social media to vent their frustration. Fans on Twitter were quick to share their frustrations at the booing — with some suggesting Richmond need to get their game organised. The club had a meeting with a small group of fans after the game. It's one thing being outraged at someone's behaviour on the field or being upset that someone is booing, but you can't take it out on people outside the stadium. That's just wrong. Why were players not able to control their anger? What should players do differently this week?

The biggest change you can make for people in this town is to tell them what they want — the only thing that can kill the spirit of our town is lies, said Councilman James White. "And the fact is in this city we live in these lies all the time." White is trying to pass a new resolution, which will require residents not only to report crime and suspicious activity, but also to provide video and photography if the police don't return their calls. And this is the kind of thing that was considered so taboo under the Reagan administration that Mayor Thomas T. Phelan called them "political correctness run amok." But, in the 1990s, when some white liberals were outraged that African-Americans might be having trouble finding a house, it became acceptable, especially on the East Side, to ask every African-American homeowner to take out a map of his neighborhood and show it to a white person. And some of these maps included tiny details such as the race of the house next door to yours. The practice was called "redlining." It was a way to discriminate against people. I did a story on it for The Baltimore Sun in 1998. (I still have it at the Sun's archives, and am glad I was there at the time). To show the racial maps wasn't all about race, the mayor of Baltimore and the head of the city Housing Authority even used the images in their promotional literature: "In this historic neighborhood, you can look at the map to discover what kind of neighborhood awaits you," the housing Authority said in a statement. Now many years later, what we have learned about what "dynamic" means in urban planning is that if it benefits the white majority to not rent to African Americans, or if it benefits the minority to have to live next to white people, that's called "dynamic." The only race that can't afford to live in a neighborhood is one that isn't white. But with our diversity, who says who counts as African-Americans? I am black. I want to live in a black neighborhood — where I feel safe and can enjoy playing baseball at Camden Yards, the Orioles, the University of Maryland and the Inner Harbor. I'd like to buy a house in the Eastern Shore, where it has cool bars, live-work lofts and cool restaurants. I'm interested in the area. But I can't because it's in the middle of an African-American town. A black neighborhood, if we want a neighborhood, does not have to be just white. There are African-Americans across the country fighting to be recognized for their place in this country, and one of the best ways to do that is to live in a black neighborhood — not a white neighborhood. No, I am more than a neighbor to white people. I'm one of them. My skin is lighter and my hair is frizzier. Some people don't like the look because they want to believe that "there are no black people in Baltimore." So, to people who want to tell me I have no place in the city, what in the hell are you talking about? To you who say I should accept less than I feel like I am entitled to — where do you live? Where do you worship? If you think the mayor can't be trusted to build a black neighborhood without white help, we can only imagine what he's thinking. But the mayor doesn't want the support of you — and, as I see it, neither do you. Donte' Stallworth was a Baltimore Sun reporter for more than a dozen years. Follow him on Twitter at @dontebstallworth Towson Times columnist David Simon's opinion column appears regularly in the Baltimore Sun.

The first episode of our new series 'The Good Life' starts here today (November 11) on Netflix. This series is about good things. The Good Life is about giving, living in joy, in community, by sharing. It's about helping people, being inspired and doing great things. It's also a series of 'Good' stories and our first series focused solely on the personal stories of seven individuals, sharing their life stories together. We are working with Netflix on a second season which will follow the story of those characters and include six more to follow. That second season is expected to premiere in 2018. The first episode follows David, a writer whose brother and sister commit suicide. David must confront his guilt at his failures, but learns from his brother that the things most needed in life have nothing to do with material goods. Away from home, David travels to Greece and learns how to share his talents and make a living teaching guitar to children. On the other coast, a teenager named Jules travels to Peru with a backpack full of money, only to find poverty and conflict. His hopes of finding something worthwhile are shattered by some bad decisions.  of course, we don't live in a perfect world and there can be good things in life, but we must keep the focus on helping people. Even if it's doing something good to help a local tribe by helping with a disaster relief camp! We're excited. Hope you will check it out as we share our personal stories today!

It would take some serious hubris to think you can sell an album this expensive for $2M. But you don't need to be an idiot to figure it out. It's only $2M! According to TMZ, an auction on eBay on Wednesday (March 10) will pay off the remaining unsold records from Paul McCartney 's 1970s catalog. The final auction count is as follows: - The Beatles Sgt. Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band - $749,500 - The Beatles Revolver - $854,750 - The Beatles Abbey Road - $1,200,000 - The Beatles The White Album - $1,420,000 - The Beatles Anthology Two - $2,400,000 - The Beatles The Beatles: Eight Club - $7,000,000 - The Beatles Anthology Three - $20,000,000 - The Beatles Revolver Plus Anthology Two - $40,000,000 - Anthology Three - $250,000,000 The White Album was originally going to go to the Smithsonian (although I think they were not prepared for the public outrage). This is the second time a Beatles album has sold above the original price, and it is also a record. The highest price for a single Beatles album? The Beatles' Sgt. Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band which sold at auction for $749,000 in 2005. (I guess when you have a record, you can usually sell it for more.) It would take a few more thousand on top of the $1,200,000 in new record to break this record. For further information, check out the page in the source links. You can click on the "listings" tab (if one is on) to see more specific pricing. UPDATE: The White Album has been put up for sale. The auction will take place on March 17, 2013. Thanks for the update, Nick.

After two seasons of fighting a war to keep a rival tribe out of the game, Kelly and Joe continue to fight — and that fight is taking place in the bathroom. "I still don't want to quit on this season. But, you know, I've been there my whole life. I've been going into Tribal Council naked in the shower. That doesn't mean I'm not going to compete," Kelly told Yahoo. "At a certain point, you know, you have to realize, if I don't play well, I might have gotten home the first time. So, I don't want to play a character. I know what my role's going to be, but I'm just hoping I'm going to make it to the end with a strong game. And obviously, I'm still going to go into Tribal and maybe I'll play it cool or I'll take a game from someone. That's just, like, a possibility." Kelly thinks her biggest obstacle is not physically. "If I'm the one who goes home, it's going to be because I don't have any alliances at this point. So, you know, those girls may have the numbers. So, my challenge will be to have more than one alliance going to the end because I don't have anybody there for me," she said. "And even if I could build one, I just don't know if I want that. I want it to be as pure as can be, which is why I'm telling you I'm not quitting. It's my plan to play until I win. And I might not win, but I mean, I just want to win, man." Joe is feeling like his odds will improve in this game, too. "I think Kelly's going to have a tough time staying around. She was voted out just before Tribal, so I think it's time for her to go. Joe feels like he's going to be able to get to the end to win so he doesn't feel like he needs to be as loyal as Kelly is," a source previously told Yahoo. But Kelly still has her eye on her own game. "At a certain point, you know, you have to realize, if I don't play well, I might have gotten home the first time. So, I don't want to play a character. I know what my role's going to be, but I'm just hoping I'm going to make it to the end with a strong game. And obviously, I'm still going to go into Tribal and maybe I'll play it cool or I'll take a game from someone. That's just, like, a possibility," she said, admitting that she is not willing to give everyone the benefit of the doubt. "Everybody has this image of the strong-minded, stoic, alpha-person when it comes to Survivor. I don't think that's who I am," she said. For more on the Survivor finale, including an exclusive video interview with Jeff Probst, tune in to the finale live to PEOPLE NOW. Additional reporting by RYAN STRAVATO

A new law that requires transgender people to use the bathrooms consistent with the sex on their birth certificate is headed to President Donald Trump — and if he signs the measure, the federal government will no longer be able to discriminate against them. "The bathroom problem is really a political issue," Matt Wood, a legislative counsel at the Human Rights Campaign, a gay rights advocacy group, told NBC News. "This is a federal issue and the federal government has a huge stake in it." Wood said the law represents "another step toward the full inclusion of transgender and gender non-conforming people" because it gives them the same federal rights as every other American. Trump, who has been a tough critic of President Barack Obama's transgender bathroom policy, has yet to comment on the law. But activists already view the law as a sign that the tide of transgender acceptance may be coming to a close. "My hope is that this is just the beginning of the end," Sarah Warbelow, the legal director at the Human Rights Campaign, told NBC News. "This is a major achievement that we're seeing happen. We have not had this many victories at the federal level." For years, civil rights groups have argued that transgender women should have the choice to use the bathroom in line with their self-identified gender. But the Obama administration and some states have fought against these rights saying it would infringe on privacy. A federal judge in Texas decided that the Obama administration could not enforce a mandate in July, a decision that blocked the Department of Justice from enforcing Title VII of the Civil Rights Act, which prohibits sex discrimination in public accommodations. But a federal appeals court on Thursday reversed the judge's decision and said the Obama administration could enforce the directive. "They can tell you that there will be privacy concerns — there will be all sorts of privacy concerns," Michael Silverman, the executive director of the Transgender Law Center (TLC), told NBC News. "But the bottom line is, you do not have the right to make somebody else uncomfortable. … This is all going to create an environment in which transgender people are less likely to know they have all this in their back pocket." Now, the issue could finally be headed to the desk of the president who promised to restore the honor of "dying with honor." In May 2016, after the Supreme Court gutted a key part of the historic Defense of Marriage Act, a president could have ordered federal agencies to abide by the ruling in order to allow legally married same-sex couples the privacy for which they have long fought. Trump's first six months in office have been marked by a steady rollback of federal protections that protect LGBT people. And the transgender bathroom issue is one more example of that. Under Obama, the U.S. government had issued guidelines stating that schools should allow transgender students to use facilities conforming with their gender identity. But in July 2017, Trump issued a memorandum that said the Obama Administration had been "wrong" and instructed the Department of Homeland Security to stop defending the Obama guidance against the federal courts. That triggered a lawsuit by states. The Obama administration defended its new guidelines in court, saying any federal employee could simply tell a school that they support transgender rights in bathrooms and locker rooms. But the Obama Administration was forced to walk that back, arguing that the administration was only protecting children in the name of diversity. And in December, the U.S. Court of Appeals for the 8th Circuit ruled that the government should have to follow the guidance. "For the first time, the administration can't claim neutrality in enforcing the law," Wood said. "It's not just a case of 'trust me' any more. The administration is now obligated to do its job and enforce federal law." Still, advocates warn that the fight to protect transgender rights hasn't truly ended for the transgender community. The battle will go on. The Department of Justice has said it will enforce the new guidance. On Thursday, the agency released guidelines that advise schools how to treat transgender students, as well as how they should handle transgender personnel who might come forward to share information about their transition. Even as the president moves forward, advocates will continue to work to ensure the full equality they have fought for — as well as their own safety. "We need to stop being afraid to use the restroom," Wood said. "We need to stop being afraid that our own parents won't know we're here." This article has been updated to include comments by Michael Silverman with the Transgender Law Center.

In what will undoubtedly come as a disappointment to fans who are hoping for a real continuation of the Dark Knight's story, Warner Bros. has announced the first-ever Batman "Rage on the Streets of Gotham" game will be coming to the Xbox 360 and PC sometime in the very near future. At the moment, we don't know a definite release date—but what we do know is that the game is coming exclusively to XBLA and Steam. Here's a very rough screenshot of the game that Warner Bros. sent over earlier today for approval: No release date has been set yet for the game, but the company sent over a pretty extensive overview of the game in an email to Xbox World: A single player narrative driven game, Batman vs. the Arkham Knight is about the ultimate battle between good and evil as you play as Batman who must face his greatest threats as he fights Gotham's most dangerous criminals. Utilizing new technologies and techniques that leverage a rich universe of Warner Bros. properties, including Batman, The Dark Knight, Justice League, The Joker and other DC Comics characters, Batman's greatest foes will unite to unleash an all-out assault on Gotham City that will span the entire year in March to serve as a prologue to the climactic event, Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice. The game takes inspiration from The LEGO Movie and features a huge roster of DC Comics characters and more than 150 characters and villains are playable. The game is built from the ground up to be the ultimate Batman game and includes a whole new game engine for next gen consoles and PC and features a new physics system that provides amazing physicality when interacting with Batman's gadgets and weapons. There is a variety of mission types including story and side quests, action-packed chase segments and the ability for players to play with co-op gameplay. It isn't much to go on, but from what we know so far, the upcoming XBLA version of Batman vs. Arkham Knight will be a lot more than a mere port. Hopefully, players should have more information in a few weeks when Warner Bros. confirms when they'll be ready for a potential March 10th release.

It's still technically summer, but we can all tell this is not your average day. There's plenty of time to fill with activities, be they at the park, home or in the park. Here are 10 fun events you can take part in in a town full of fun. Some are outdoors so bring your own shoes and sunscreen or get the sunscreen, or wear your sunglasses and enjoy the sun while at the park and take the kids to the park for something different. There is no doubt that these are some of the fun things to do in your community, some are going to be outdoors so you should bring your own shoes and sunscreen or get the sunscreen and wear sunscreen while at the park. This list is from the best to some of the newest ones you might want to check out as the summer season progresses. Take a Walk or Ride The best time to do something like this is in the park, a park you can enjoy with the whole family. We've highlighted some great places that you can get together in town where you can take a nice run or a bike ride or walk up and down the street with your family. You could even take that same run for an hour or two. Some of our favorites for this are the Park on Main Trailhead in South Park or Mill Creek Trailhead in Oak Hollow Woods on Main. It's easy to do both and you can do it every single day if you want to. Make a Splash While at the Pool You can splash around at a variety of pools around town and they all are open from 8 a.m. to 8 p.m. There are some pools with lifeguards and some that are completely open to the public. Many places will have ice water in the water but you won't find that at a pool with lifeguards. Some pools also have a spray feature where you can use your beverage or towel to get rid of all the water on your body. Visit a Car Show Not only is car show season in the summer, there are tons of car shows right now, most of them in towns that are within a short drive from the Twin Cities. So if you are going out of your way to go to a car show in your area, make sure to plan ahead and visit when car show season is happening. You'll find the car show locations throughout the summer. If you've been looking for a car show to attend, you might want to check out the Minnesota Auto Show. It is a two-day event with lots of different types of cars on display along with food and entertainment. Spend an Evening at the Ball Game We do this all the time, we go to the game. Why not spend some more time with your friends and your families and spend some money with your friends and enjoy a good ball game or a baseball game? At this point in Minnesota baseball season people are doing it for their children and young adults as a family activity. So that's a big reason why people are out there spending money so much on a ball game. We recommend getting a group together for a group outing to watch the game. Some great places like the Twins' season tickets or the Twins VIP Night are great starting points for getting together as a group. Take a Boat Ride Minnesota has amazing beaches and lakes so why not spend the afternoon relaxing in a boat as you go fishing in the summer. The state does a lot of things right when it comes to having great beaches and lakes. Check out the lake beaches throughout the summer for some great fishing on the lake and some nice scenery along the way. And if you want to have a sailboat ride or just relax on an outdoor trip at the lake then check out The Beach at Lake Wobegon in Bayfield or the Bayside Boat Rentals in Moorhead. Go to the Ice Cream Stand This is one thing you probably love the most because it's fun to go and find something new to try. We've already told you you should take the kids off to the park and let 'em explore their own and try something new, what better time to stop at the ice cream stand and stock up? The Ice Cream Stand has an open door policy so they are always looking for new customers to bring in their ice cream. They have different kinds of treats that can really change the way you look at ice cream. We recommend the Popsicles with Fruit, Banana, Chocolate and Lemon. You can also get a Caramel Macchiato or other kind of ice cream or just go with the classic Strawberry Shortcake. There's tons more to try at places like the Ice Cream Stand. Play in the Pool or the Beach The summer is an incredible time for kids to come out and enjoy the water in the city and the beach or even on a boat. So what are you waiting for? Let's take these things to the next level. You can always visit the beaches that have lifeguards in the summer as the parks

I've been playing with the new version of the Google Chrome apps lately, and I've noticed a few things that might take some people out of the equation altogether. Now, I'm probably just as guilty as the next user of Chrome for failing to use Chrome's new design elements very well (if I'm being honest, I usually just try to get rid of it as quickly as possible), but if you look at this screenshot from my recent update, you'll notice that there's an all new button that appears on a tab's browser bar when it's using Chrome's new tab menu. This button will pop up a mini-menus for the currently selected tab, as well as a large tab menu with a few small thumbnails for the currently available apps (not all apps will show up: for example, it looks like some sites won't show up even in the main menu). While this is a nice looking feature, I feel that you would only want to have one tab bar tab selected at a time, as opposed to the two in the previous version of Google Chrome. This isn't the only new feature you'll notice with the updates. The Chrome team has also fixed a number of bugs with the browser itself. For example, you may find that the mouse pointer no longer shakes when you hover over a search result on the URL bar. You may also be happy to learn that Chrome will now remember the last five websites you've visited, so that you can quickly return to them in the future. These five websites, including the page or sections you visited last, will appear on the bottom of the left-hand window, and clicking them or double-clicking the page they're on will open up a new tab with the same URL in a new location. Google's also included a bunch of other small-ish new features. You might get the sense that a few of these appear to be new ideas that were sitting around somewhere until recently, like the ability to see your recently opened sites (even in the new tab menu), or the extension option, which allows extensions to install directly in Chrome without having to install third-party add-ons. You'll also notice that the site or app you're currently viewing now appears on the browser tab itself, rather than a tab in the new tab menu. Instead of being listed first in the menu, the site will appear below the current tab in the list. This is because the page is already open when you open the menu, so it's better for both the site developer and the user to take advantage of the menu instead of the original tab bar being split to reflect the fact that a webpage is already open. As for the new tab menu: while some users might be uncomfortable with seeing their most recent search hits onscreen so soon after getting a tab, I think it's a useful feature that will help Chrome's users more easily find specific sites that you want to go to. So, in conclusion, I'm pretty excited about these updates to the Chrome browser, and I hope to see other users find them useful too. The only downside I can find is that those without the latest version will find these updates pretty slow, as it takes a while for the pages to load. If that is the case for you, you might want to wait until more people test these out and then share your experiences. You can check out the latest version of Google's Chrome at chrome.google.com (or update to the latest version manually if you're on Windows), but these updates should appear over the next few days.

This is no longer the 1960s. That's the opening line of a recent column in the New York Times, in which writer Eric Lipton describes how we are no longer talking about a cultural conflict between the left and the right. Now we are in "a war," which he sees as one that's increasingly turning on the economy. Liberals are "taking back" the economy—the way they "reversed Republican control of government at three government agencies"—as a means to protect workers' rights, make work pay and protect the environment. We might call this the "New Democrats" theory of politics. It is based on the idea that left-wing politicians' policies can help the economy take off, which in turn will help the government's ability to do the things that we all want it to do—such as take over control of large sectors of the economy and enact new safety net programs. If Democrats control the White House and Congress then, as they hope to do, they can enact policy changes that will make working people much more prosperous—and thereby help the government get elected again. The New Democrats' theory has been tested on the ground. During the eight years of the so-called recovery, the economy has grown at a blistering pace—much faster than in the preceding recovery, which began eight years before President Obama took office—but the economy has been more sluggish in 2013 than it was during the last recovery. The New Democrats take this to mean that the recovery is not sustainable. According to them, the economy has to go in another direction before things start improving. The country, then, needs a president who represents "populism," who will put the public interest ahead of the interests of the rich and powerful. There are three kinds of populists—the liberal-class liberal, the moderate-class liberal or centrist Republican, and the radical-class capitalist or right-wing capitalist Democrat. The idea is that if left-wing Democrats do the right things for the economy, then they will have a better chance to get elected than if right-wing Democrats do the right things for the economy. Since the Great Recession ended in 2009, the New Democrats have had tremendous success with this theory. They have "reversed" their party's long-time support for free trade deals, especially those with Asian countries like China and South Korea. They have supported expanding Social Security and Medicaid (including in their budgets recently, for example, by putting them on the back burner while slashing spending on food stamps). They have put into place a number of regulations aimed at curbing the financial sector, including the Dodd–Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act and the 2010 Dodd–Frank financial reform law. And now, as the economy grows again, New Democrats are arguing that the economy should be allowed to grow to the point where it reaches full employment, which in turn will create more jobs. It is not that the New Democrats have never been proponents of policies that could have a positive effect on the economy. In the early 2000s, during the Clinton era, that was one of the arguments that the New Democrats used to argue for a strong national health-care system and a high minimum wage. After all, a strong economy is a big reason why people have a right to health care and to the minimum wage. And yes, the New Democrats have been pushing government spending as well—particularly on infrastructure projects—as well as for education and job training. But what makes the New Democrats different from the more conservative-leaning Republicans who used to represent this party is that some of the New Dems actually believe that government is needed today to help workers, create jobs and protect the environment—and that if government does these things for the right reasons, then it can actually help the economy grow. If this is the case, then there is a big question that remains unanswered: Can these policies actually help people rise out of poverty and the struggle for decent employment? If the New Democrats can't answer that question, then they are more than a little out of touch with the real concerns of voters.

The latest in a line of attacks to hit the city of Aleppo earlier this week, Syrian government warplanes pounded rebel held areas of the city in an unprecedented campaign against the rebel-held districts of the city. The airstrikes took place at 7 a.m., the United Nations said, after the first aerial assault of the new conflict. A number of the strikes were reported to have hit residential areas of eastern Aleppo with at least one report stating that at least five persons were killed in the assaults. At the time of writing, at least eight civilians had been reported killed from the airstrikes, but the toll later declined to eight as pro-regime websites claimed their coverage had been "mistaken." Russia and Syria have previously carried out strikes in Syria as part of the ongoing Russia and Iranian intervention in the country's six-year war, which has already killed tens of thousands of people and left millions homeless. Russia claimed it would target terrorist groups in eastern Aleppo, but has been accused of targeting both regime forces and opposition fighters. According to Human Rights Watch (HRW), the Russian operation in Syria was in stark contrast to the campaign against rebel held areas of Aleppo in early January, when they targeted "no-go zones" and civilian areas. "This is Syria doing what Assad is doing in other cities," said Nadim Houry, HRW Middle East director. "The warplanes came in at the same time as the bombing campaign, and the only difference is that now Aleppo residents know they are at the wrong end of the barrel bombs." Syrian Foreign Minister Walid Al-Moallem also insisted in an interview with Lebanese daily Al-Akhbar. He said the bombing of government-held eastern Aleppo is in "self-defense." The bombings had been planned "for several months" by Russian military commanders, Al-Moallem said, according to Al-Akhbar's translation.

It's the most exciting time of the year! And we're more excited because we can't wait until it's over. But there's still a whole lot of work to do. And to make matters worse, it will get even worse as we approach the season end. If we're going to get a full season going this year, we need to finish up production on Volume One. We want it to be perfect. Let's work together to not only get everyone on track for next season, but also finish the production of Volume One. It's the beginning of October, and we need you to tell us about the last episode of this season. When Volume Two premieres, all of your support and comments will help bring us a little closer to our stretch goal of getting Volume One out for everyone, because we can't do it without you! With your support, we will get Volume One out to you. That means the perfect set of posters to hang in your living room and on your walls, a volume that is not only complete, but also beautiful. We've already started on Volume Two, including the artwork, story, scripts, and music. Your support will go a long way. But we need to raise around $18,000 for the printing of the posters, the fees for sound design, and to cover any fees incurred during production. Your help in this goal is critical. With a little push, we can make this a reality! All rewards are add-ons, meaning you can choose more than one thing to your pledge. We are offering four pledge tiers, five bonus add-on rewards, each of which is $15. When you pledge, you will select the pledge level that looks like this: The best way to make your choice for this stretch goal is to use Kickstarter's Pledge Calculator in your pledge manager. If necessary, you can click the Add-on button to add on any of these extra rewards. Below you can see how the tiers all fit together. In addition to the Kickstarter exclusive add-ons listed, you can add on any one of the bonus add-ons by clicking the extra reward button in the Pledgemanager. Stretch Goals: $18K - We will publish the original story of Volume One to the anthology. The anthology will include Volume One and another story from Volume Two.
