By Jeff Conant | NJ Advance Media for NJ.com When the New Jersey Devils' 2014 team first emerged on the ice in the summer of 2012, it seemed like some things were changing on and off the ice for the franchise. New coaches. New GMs. Two rookies head coaches who would be the fourth in franchise history, replacing the first two — Kevin Rooney and Lou Lamoriello, respectively. For many NHL players, such a turn of events would be an eye-opening experience. For the Devils, it was their biggest offseason of the past decade, and perhaps the most pivotal move they made in the process -- in addition to many others. The Devils came onto the ice in 2012 with a group of 18 players in their first training camp, which was the third in eight years with a new coach -- Pete DeBoer. The Devils had three games in 2013-14 after trading Cory Schneider to San Jose, but still had players from 2011-12 in attendance. That was a big, big chunk of change for a team that finished 12th in the East during the 2010-11 season. "The biggest thing last year is how I felt as a hockey player, because I really didn't know, for a long time, what to expect," said goalie Cory Schneider. "I was trying to make a transition to this league, just trying to make the team, making the team a better team, and I didn't really know what to expect. "At that time last year, I didn't know what to expect. It was, if they were good or bad, I wasn't worried," Schneider said. "Now having that experience and knowing how I felt in that situation, I have confidence in them that they can do this. There are no excuses now." After the 2013 season ended by losing in the first round of the Stanley Cup Playoffs, DeBoer was fired after the Devils had made a disastrous playoff exit, with a roster that was largely left without veteran players from that season. The team was stocked with 22-year-olds and under-25 players, which was not ideal. The team did not have a first-round pick to replenish their prospect pool, which resulted in a rebuilding process. "When you're rebuilding, guys are growing and getting more and more experience. It's a good time to be a young player. We're starting to get some experience from guys playing in the World Championships here, too," said goaltender Cory Schneider. At the center of the rebuild was Travis Zajac, the former second-round pick who was traded to the New York Rangers for Adam Larsson in March 2014 and returned to the Devils this season as a top forward prospect, playing with veteran players Michael Ryder and John Moore. The 2014 team had three forwards under contract to go to camp in 2013, and none of them made it over to try out for the NHL team. That, it turned out, had been Zajac's plan all along; while he was still in the AHL, he started reading about the team and began plotting how he could play his way to a call-up to the NHL during training camp. "You go into a season thinking about the season next year and about things like that," Zajac said. "You read all the time, you know everything goes into this game in one way or another so I wanted to make sure I was ready as soon as I got a chance. That's what it came down to." The Devils ended the 2013-14 season on a high note after winning their only Stanley Cup in franchise history and finishing 12th in the East. But a change at the GM position with general manager Lou Lamoriello and coach Peter DeBoer had a significant impact on the team. The Devils were eliminated in Game 7 of the Eastern Conference finals by the Philadelphia Flyers, and DeBoer and Lamoriello were then fired in the offseason. "We don't want to get to where one person's decision has a big impact on the team; it's more about what decisions are the right decisions," DeBoer told Jeff Blair of the New Jersey Star-Ledger after he was fired. "It doesn't matter who they hire as GM. We were a top-six team last year. I don't know if the team with these new personnel can be as good as it was. We're going to have a chance." The change at the top meant the Devils were left with three rookies in their first training camp (Zajac, Martin Brodeur and Andy Greene) and in the fold with limited depth. The team quickly fell, and didn't return for a full-blown rebuild until last season. "I think at the end of last year last year, we went into this off-season trying to rebuild," said Schneider. "You've got two young forwards coming here.

The state has said its decision to ban sales of e-cigarettes to youths was just a matter of public health. The state Health Department said the decision to ban sales to people under the age of 21 came after a study indicated that, in the past, teenage e-cigarette use may have caused young people to take up smoking tobacco. "We made this decision in the interest of public health," said department spokesman Stephen Dietrich in a telephone interview from Salem. "It is important to understand that we did not do this because of any anti-smoking bias or because there was concern about e-cigarette use on college campuses." The decision to ban sales of e-cigarettes to young people was approved by state health officials at the last minute before Christmas. A meeting was called at 1:30 p.m. Dec. 19 as state officials scrambled to prepare rules to ban the sale of e-cigarettes to anyone younger than 18, although the law says anyone 18 and older can purchase the devices. As a result, the e-cigarette industry went into overdrive, trying to make up for a month of missed sales. Consumers flocked to online shops, where prices fell, and sellers in the past few days have posted their sales figures and prices. In the two months since the state decision, the number of sales of e-cigarettes in Oregon has fallen from 6,800 to 3,800. The most recent figures available by the Oregon Health Authority show sales to people 18 and older fell from 25,742 units in September to 19,964 units in October and 16,928 in November. The figures represent a 14.4 percent drop from the same period last year and a 3.6 percent drop from the year before. State and industry officials in the last few days have been working behind the scenes trying to find a way to keep the new regulations in line with a previous state law that banned e-cigarette sales to people under the age of 21. The law was passed in October 2012 following the deaths of two teens in October 2011. The first was 11-year-old Matthew McPherson, who was accidentally killed when the battery in an e-cigarette he was using caught alight while he was watching pornography. In a separate incident, Christopher Gonsalves, a sophomore at Eugene High School, died of carbon monoxide poisoning after a battery in an e-cigarette caught fire during use in his car. The law's sponsor, Sen. Betsy Johnson, R-Redmond, said e-cigarettes have become a gateway tool for young people. "It is like if we had not banned alcohol," Johnson said. "The problem is they will continue to move toward more dangerous stuff and the state needs to step in." In a meeting Wednesday, state officials met with representatives of the two e-cigarette companies that supply Oregon with products. Some of the state's top health officials were in attendance to discuss the proposed regulations on Wednesday and to talk with companies, as was state Rep. Earl Blumenauer, D-Oregon City. In that meeting, and with several staffers present, Johnson said, a senior health official suggested using a percentage of e-cigarettes available for purchase to discourage usage among youth. The senior staffer suggested 25 percent or even 25 percent less products would result in a drop in the number of underage vaping products and an increase in sales. Johnson said it would not be unusual to have sales less than in a single month of a sales year like November, and that it seemed the senior state health official was implying that a certain percentage decline in sales was needed to help youth understand their choices. "It's possible," Johnson said. "It is possible. In some ways it doesn't take much if it is not happening the way the administration thought." Blumenauer said the state has a better chance of keeping rates of cigarette use through the teen years in check if it tries to encourage e-cigarette use and that the state should instead focus on public health issues. He also contended that the state should try to discourage consumption of e-cigarettes, arguing they are a "gateway" to smoking tobacco. "No adult at all should buy these products," he said. "It is not the business of the state to encourage smoking. It is the business of the state to take away the tobacco product." The state Health Department does not plan to change it e-cigarette rules, Dietrich said. "We will enforce the law as it is," he said.

I can never forget my first time taking a photo with my camera in my hand. ― Anonymous, on the first pictures he took with his camera [src] John William "Jack" Phillips was an old, white American soldier stationed at Fort Hagen, New Jersey during World War II. His father, also named John William "Jack" Phillips, was a prominent, wealthy businessman, and was a prominent citizen of Hagen. When his father was killed in action during the Battle of the Bulge, he took his first photograph during the Battle of the Bulge and later was stationed at Fort Hagen as an officer at the post. During the war, Phillips often took pictures for the public service announcements in the Post Office, in which he displayed his photography skills; his photographs often showed him in the midst of battle, standing alongside his commanding officer. In 1951, a Japanese spy named Hiroo Onoda stole all the photographs from the Hagen Post Office. With the help of a fellow pilot named John "Jack" Farragut, Phillips and Farragut flew into the North Sea and recovered the photographs from the submarine in which Onoda had taken them. Farragut gave Phillips the photographs to be held up as evidence against Onoda. The photographs were seen in the courtroom during a court-martial. In 1952, Onoda confessed to murdering his father, John Farragut. However, he refused to admit to the charges of treason against Phillips and Farragut. Onoda was subsequently sentenced to life in prison and was released from prison in 1954, four years prior to the film's events. Contents show] Biography Early life and death One day on April 26, 1942, Phillips' father, John William "Jack" Phillips was killed aboard a B-17 Flying Fortress when a mortar shell exploded near the plane's engine. The death of his father caused Phillips an overwhelming sense of grief after his mother, his aunt and his great-aunt were all killed by Nazi Germany during World War II. In May 1943, Phillips' father was killed by another mortar shell explosion while helping the Army Air Force repair their B-17 Flying Fortress when all of them had returned from training. The death of his father became a traumatic event that Phillips never wanted to forget. During his post-war military training in New Jersey, Phillips met a young woman named Alice Cathery who was a photographer at Fort Hagen during this time and asked her if Phillips could have a few photos taken for a poster the Army was printing that was supposed to be the story of his life. The photo of him in the post office building was his first and, at the time, is the only photograph Phillips ever took. In 1956, he took his first photograph, taking a picture on April 26,1946 that shows him sitting on top of his bed in his house on the beach near his home in Hoboken, New Jersey. He would take many more photos, often from behind and standing alongside his superiors in the Army. The photo, however, did not become a successful advertisement for his job and he did not find the image particularly appealing. He took many more photographs of his home, of himself and his family and took his first picture of his father, John William "Jack" Phillips, which he would later show in court during an infamous court-martial in 1951 in which Phillips was accused of having committed treason against the United States of America; he refused to deny the charge of treason and was sentenced to life imprisonment from that night till he was eventually released from prison in 1954. World War II and the film After the war, Phillips continued his career by being a photographer at Fort Hagen during the war's early months. He started at Fort Hagen on June 28, 1941, and served there as an infantryman until June 1946. He died of pneumonia at Fort Hagen on November 2, 1947.[2] During the final moments of the film, the photograph of Jack Phillips was used as evidence against his enemy, Hiroo Onoda, during an American court-martial. Jack Phillips did not get to see his father, and it was not his first time with the death of his father. Phillips became increasingly emotional after learning why he was going to court and that he was going along with his lie against the Japanese.[3] His son, John William "Jack" Farragut, had taken his father's photograph in the post office to be shown to the court so that they could believe his side of the story for his sentence. Personality and traits "In this place where we've grown up, we just don't know what to think of death. We don't want to see a face that hurts. We just want peace. " ― Jack Phillips, on the loss of his father, to his son, John William "Jack" Farragut [src] Phillips had a strong

The University of Maryland, one of the nation's most elite universities, is offering scholarships for women to obtain a master of science degree or a master of fine arts degree after graduation. The four-year scholarships -- designed for those who are currently taking graduate work in "traditional fine arts disciplines" -- were "designed to give our outstanding female students the opportunity to pursue career opportunities in our highly competitive field," said Deborah E. J. Johnson, dean of the University of Maryland's College of Arts and Sciences, in an email. The scholarships, available starting in 2018-19, will award $15,000 each for undergraduate and graduate students in fine arts fields from across the world. "We have long made a commitment to giving students -- students of color, students in low-income communities, students with disabilities -- an equal opportunity to study at one of our schools," Johnson said. "Our scholarship plan reflects that belief, focusing on the undergraduate and graduate degrees where the most talented women pursue the opportunity to further their education." Johnson said the scholarship system is an expansion of existing financial aid that can be used to support undergraduate and graduate students in such areas as fine arts, music, and the performing arts. To be eligible for the four-year scholarships, students must be accepted into a full-time degree program at the University of Maryland, or currently in another program that will count as one of the four-year programs. There are no prerequisites for the scholarship plans to be applied. The College of Fine Arts and the College of Design at Maryland will not be eligible for the four-year scholarships, according to the emails sent to female students last month and first reported by the Annapolis Citizen. "If you are currently in another school that counts as both a degree program and a traditional fine arts field you will not be eligible for these scholarships," Johnson said. The online application was launched Wednesday. A special website with links to scholarship opportunities was created and a "sign-up" period will be offered in the next few weeks. Applicants who qualify for scholarships will then be contacted by each college, Johnson said. Students will need to apply separately for each institution, she said. Applications for both the graduate and undergraduate degree programs can be downloaded from the University of Maryland's website. Johnson's email noted that the university would also be offering awards for graduate students who seek scholarships for master's and doctoral degrees through the Maryland Higher Educational Enhancement Program, which is available to students with financial need. Other benefits include a reduced tuition rate for graduate students in those two fields, the ability to earn a master of fine arts degree in two years, and the option to double course and double tuition, Johnson added, according to the email. The scholarship money is available for all students who are admitted into a full-time undergraduate program with a major in fine arts and fine arts education or from another discipline that is an area of study in which there is a shortage of students pursuing a degree. The four-year awards are for the second year of a student's undergraduate degree and for the first year of a student's graduate degree, if she enters the graduate program without other scholarships offered in that area. Django 1.10 released Today we're excited to release Django 1.10, the biggest release since Django 1.0. As always, we're pleased with the momentum behind the project and the contributions we're receiving. This is a tremendous opportunity to polish, improve and expand the best Python web development framework there is. What's new in Django 1.10 New in Django 1.10 are: The Django 1.10 release is only the beginning. We've planned many more features to come after our current roadmap. As always, you can download Django 1.10 from the Django download page and get Django 1.9 as well. Notable new features The biggest change to Django in Django 1.10 is the introduction of Template Toolkit. Using Template Toolkit you can build your own templating engine in minutes by importing the django.template.tempotest module. It is based on django.template.toolkit.FrameworkChoice and extends the basic concepts to a generic templating engine for your Django projects. As a bonus it also lets you define your template with HTML5/Javascript using the {{%html %}} and {{%javascript %}} tags. It can be used on any template using the import django.http.HttpContexts.loaders , and can be imported alongside from django.template.toolkit . Temporary files One problem that we heard about in our previous Django 1.9 release was how to handle temporary files such as images. For example, this is how you can upload a .gif image file from disk to a disk image host: upload( 'myimg.gif', 'my_app_file_name@foo.png', media_type='image/gif', name='myfile' ) That works great if you have a lot of small image files, but if you have a big site with many image files, then it can get tricky. We recommend you use either the django.template.tempdir package, or the django.template.tmp module, depending on your application. Both of these are documented on the Django docs site under django-templating-utils, django-templedirs and django-templating-engine respectively. New user management For many users, the last thing they want to deal with is the complexity of adding a user to a Django database. We've included tools to make it easier to add, modify and delete users without worrying about the internals of the framework. We started off by introducing the auth_user helper that can be used in two ways. The first is to make a Django model instance with user information and use it as a user: from django.contrib.auth.models import Meta class MyApplicationUser ( models . Model ): address = models . CharField ( max_length = 15 ) birthday = models . DateTimeField ( auto_now_add = True ) The second use case for auth_user is to add a User object that can't be stored in an existing table, and that is stored instead in the admin database. from django.contrib.auth.models import Meta class MyApplicationAdminUser ( admin . ModelAdmin ): user = User . objects . create ( name = 'myappuser' ) There is also the auth_register and auth_regist methods to add and manage users in the admin database. These make use of the same functions you would call if you were adding a user to an existing model. New authlib The most significant new component of Django 1.10 is a new set of APIs and views that enable you to get authorization information from users. It's a powerful way to authenticate users in your application in a more simple and efficient way than the existing auth system in Django. For more details check out the auth.html specification. Password changes For users the primary problem facing them when using the django admin is updating passwords and passwords files. This new feature lets you provide an error when a password has changed while you are editing a password file. The update.save_exceptions setting defaults to False , which is a more convenient default. With the new functionality a password can be updated while another action is happening in the same session. For example a user can use the password field, update a password for that file and then save the saved file. This can simplify the process of editing a password file. django.contrib.auth.models import DjangoCookieAuth from django.contrib.auth.fields import PasswordChangeField from django.contrib.auth.models import RequestProxy from django.contrib.auth.utils import get_preflight_data set_preflight() class PasswordChangeField ( PasswordChangeField ): model = PasswordChange

The city and the state are taking a look at how to use the revenue from the sale of beer and wine as tax revenue. On Tuesday, the council's finance committee voted to study selling off the state's liquor sales. The committee also approved an ordinance to use the beer sales in the city's bond measure. Beer is not taxed in the state. The city currently has the authority to tax it. Alcohol sales have been rising across the state. There are plans to spend $100 million on adding 1,600 to 2,000 more liquor licenses.

After a brief hiatus, Pizzagate has resurfaced. Some are claiming it's an example of the elite using conspiracy theories as a means of control, even though most members of the elite have yet to make any actual claims about the theory. Others are claiming it is yet another instance of media hysteria — yet again, an argument that the elites themselves would never utter. Pizzagate, which is being called a "coverup" by some and a smear campaign by others, was the subject of an article in the Washington-based magazine The Hill on November 22, 2016 . The article was written by Michael Tracey. Tracey writes: "It is the belief of many that the Democratic National Committee was somehow involved in a massive, coordinated pedophile ring targeting the DC-area pizza chain Comet Ping Pong. "The claims that the pizza joint harbored a child abuse ring run wild on message boards, alternative news sites and Reddit, with one poster going as far as to say that 'the pedophiles have taken over the Democrats.' A YouTube user with the handle Comet Ping Pong Pizza shared a "selfie" with the logo of the restaurant and the statement, 'Pizzagate Facts,' before it was taken down, and then re-uploaded using a different logo to show the same logo with the hashtag #pizzagate. Other photos, videos and text sharing Comet Ping Pong's connections to a satanic pedophile ring are widely available. "But the conspiracy theory goes further: the restaurant has been used as a brothel for wealthy DC-area men who want to have sex with underage girls…Pizzagate is the most popular topic on a Reddit forum called r/The_Donald, where it has been discussed since March 2016 before a top moderator deleted comments and banned members as a precautionary measure. "While many are skeptical, there is abundant photographic evidence of Comet Ping Pong's pedo imagery, which can be seen on the pizzapizzagate wiki. "Even President-elect Donald Trump weighed in to accuse the restaurant of doing 'what we call in Washington bad and illegal things': "I heard many bad and disgusting things about Ted Cruz, but when I hear 'little Marco,' I think of my daughters — nothing but love! Ted Cruz is bad!" In response, a video from the "Pizzagate" subreddit titled "The D.C. Madam" was posted on November 23, 2016. "I wanted to see how many people here still believed that we are in fact the victims of a pedophile ring run by the DNC," the video begins before a woman named Samantha M. writes about her experience working at a restaurant called Comet Ping Pong. "If you did not believe this and were still in a state of shock and disbelief, I would really appreciate it if you stayed tuned. I wanted to show you the very, very disturbing, shocking proof that we are not in fact talking about a child sex ring here!" After the woman describes the alleged sex abuse she received and says she hopes this will make people think about the allegations, a voice from a video camera says "Goodbye. Thanks for watching." The full video, which was posted on November 15, 2015, can be seen for yourself here. It features some of the best commentary from Pizzagate supporters who have taken the time to watch it in its entirety and offer commentary. It also includes commentary from a different person who was allegedly a "private investigator who took the time to investigate" and claim the videos were "fabricated." The man, identified in the chatroom as Matt Forney, also claims in the video that "it is the establishment itself that is the target of these allegations." "I'm very confident that we found this place and we found everything we were looking for." The comments section of Forney's video begins with his video claiming that he and his team of private investigators have been given "the keys to the investigation." He then goes on a very detailed explanation of what he says the establishment has done to ensure pedophilia doesn't run rampant. "I'm also going to show you that there is no pedophilia happening at Comet Ping Pong," he says. "It's all fake news…I'm very confident that we found this place and we found everything we were looking for. You're welcome. This is a free country so I can say it." The other man who allegedly created the video, dubbed Matt Forney, had been tweeting about the conspiracy theory for over a week before his tweet about an old tape appeared on November 15, according to Alex Jones . According to The Daily Bell a former staffer of Jones, Matt Forney was fired for not being an alt-right extremist. This man also appears to own the website Infowars , which has been promoting Pizzagate since the beginning. The videos are also currently on YouTube and several have been viewed more than

New York Public Library is one of the largest libraries in the nation, having a collection of over 2 Million volumes. There is a lot of good information available about the history of the libraries, the books that are found in the collections and their origins. Here you can find out how to make use of the most relevant information and information on each books in your collection. New York Public Library Book Description These books are all about New York City. From early history books to contemporary urban news, from books about New York fashion and fashion design to history books and travelogues about New York. With the right info, you would be able to find useful information about New York city. New York City: A World Atlas, 1882 New York City: A World Atlas 1882 is another one of the city's historical books. Although it is not in the same format as the books mentioned above, you will find most of the same information, including a description of the buildings, the main landmarks and streets, maps, a listing of hotels and restaurants, and a list of shops and restaurants. Some of these are included in the book that you will find later on, with the others not mentioned. Syracuse Historical Map, 1890 and Map 3.5 The following maps from this book will help you find a lot of information. These are great for finding a place to eat, a place to shop, a place to find a doctor or any other necessary item. The first map is the map of Syracuse published in 1890, while the 2nd map is the most recent. The Times Atlas and Dictionary of New York City, 1892 and The New York City Atlas 1892 These maps show Manhattan, New York. The Times Atlas shows the buildings of Manhattan as they existed in the early 19th century, while the New York City Atlas shows what they looked like at the turn of the century. The first map was published in 1892, while the second and most recent was published in 2000. I am really looking forward to the 3rd edition that is to be released soon. The Empire State Building The Empire State Building that is part of the New York State Building is a fantastic object to research books on. It contains two separate maps on its side, one of the building and a larger one showing the entire city at 12 days intervals. These maps are made by the New York Department of City Planning. On the left, a picture of the building is shown from a high angle. From the middle of the building to the top of the tower are 12 days, with the top 5 days at sunrise and 7 days of sunset. This is a great reference to help to identify locations throughout the city. Also, the image shows you a scale for reference. The Empire State Building and Lower Manhattan is another great book that will help with finding books that have information regarding this unique landmark. New York City Guidebook, 1891 This guidebook is a compilation of some of the earlier guides printed before 1870 that have been edited, updated and published over the past 150 years to help guide visitors to New York City. Included is information of various places in the city such as stores, churches, hotels, restaurants and so on. The Guidebook to New York City is divided into two volumes, covering the period from 1851 to 1960, and then focusing on the period from 1960 onward. Hudson River Park The Hudson River Park is a great place to find some information about your next town, whether it be a new business, restaurant or a park. Hudson River Park contains information at every level, such as the names of parks, the names of neighborhoods, the town names, and more. Hudson River Park is very well maintained, and features great signage and is a great place to stay. New York Public Library We have a large collection of books, music and photographs in the NYPL. This library contains some of the best information on any subject in New York City. A guide on where to find the books, for instance, will guide the reader toward the relevant information, including where to go to find them.

[bitcoin-dev] Why is BIP100 not signaling for BIP148? Hi Peter, I think I understand what Gavin is saying correctly, but this is not what I want to say here... I thought we were in agreement that miners and nodes need to do at least the BIP141 activation (BIP141 in this case). Now, in order to make the activation possible, miners should make all blocks that have a BIP148 sig signature on them by the October 23 date. I think this would give the BIP141 nodes enough time to accept a new main chain in favor of the BIP148 Segwit2X nodes. So I want to ask whether this would not be a mistake on the part of the mining community. If BIP141 is activated, there will be a BIP141 node that refuses to accept any blocks with a BIP148 sig signed on them. So, if a miner does that, it would not force another chain to win. But for BIP148, as Gavin says, if a BIP149 node refuses to accept a block containing it, this would mean that at least one BIP149 node has a BIP148 chain by default, which is not what miners or the network wants. If we do get to a situation where an older BIP148 node refuses to accept a block containing a BIP148 sig, perhaps someone will find an older chain with a valid validator ID smaller than BIP148 that would allow the node to accept and relay those blocks. Also, I think we should talk seriously with both sides of this debate to determine which is in the best interest. Mike Belshe - 1HrGc9yXdFzPvxG8g3QrvLwX2Jk6YUy

In his book, "Unfettered" (Focal Press, 2011), Stephen Covey has an article where he takes stock of the cultural transformation that has happened to women and how little we take into account that our behavior and attitudes are a direct byproduct not only of the cultural change, but also of our genetics and biology. I would strongly believe that we have to take some responsibility for our lifestyle if we want to be successful and happy. You may be surprised at how little you are aware how far a mile from the ground you really are.

The latest news from the #SkepticalScience blog reveals the new face of climate change scepticism. That is, with the decline for the most recent year and the rise of deniers (in all shades and shapes), we now have a group of sceptics who reject the very thing that they claim to be fighting against: man-made climate change. They even admit that denying that climate change is man-made is no better than being a "closet climate change denialist". The new face of the skeptics is David Archibald who's been labelled a "climate denier" by Skeptical Science: It's not all good news, though. Skeptics are also embracing the use of denial science when it can be shown to be helpful to their own position of the truth of climate change. One prominent example of this is the "no global warming for 18 years" campaign led by Michael Mann. Archibald has a long history of promoting denial science. In 2010 he appeared on The Daily Show and called climate change a Chinese hoax, stating: "No, we're not living through a scientific revolution." But in 2010 the Australian Skeptics Network (ASN) found him in the comments section of Skeptical Science. In comments he said of climate change: "The Earth has been warming steadily for the past 150 years and most of the observed warming has been caused by burning of fossil fuels. So climate change theory is a load of crap." Archibald has also admitted to having a long history of supporting climate change denial, "having written at least three essays in response to recent peer review papers that have challenged the basic tenets of our understanding of climate science". While he denies his own climate change denial history, it has been exposed by numerous sources. He has also been accused of having taken money from anti-climate change organisations and having accepted substantial funding from the Australian mining industry. To date they've found only one thing he has taken public funding from, the Australian Mining Association. Their latest blog post is a response to a story in The West Australian newspaper on their recent appearance at the CSIRO. They say: [T]he claims against us in the article are a series of lies with the sole intent of destroying the Skeptics' reputation. We will never hide from a debate with people and this one is not a debate. We will not allow this to continue. These people are not people we are interested in debating or have a relationship with. We have no desire for this to become a story in the media about our views on global warming. If the truth is good enough for everyone, they should be good enough for us. They are not. The truth shall prevail. The Skeptics' views on climate change have advanced beyond those of the majority of Australians over the past decade. There are some people who hold these views, but they are in the minority. Skeptics do not accept that climate change is a hoax. We believe that global warming is happening. We believe that human activities over the past century are the main cause of most of the warming since the late 19th century. The majority of Australians believe global warming is happening. So, the Skeptics think that they have a right to hold a view that is not the majority of our community, which is why many of us have engaged in public debate and have called for the government to do something about global warming. These people are not people we are interested in debating or have a relationship with. We have no desire for this to become a story in the media about our views on global warming. If the truth is good enough for everyone, they should be good enough for us. They are not. The truth shall prevail. The Skeptics' views on climate change have advanced beyond those of the majority of Australians over the past decade. There are some people who hold these views, but they are in the minority. Skeptics do not accept that climate change is a hoax. We believe that global warming is happening. We believe that human activities over the past century are the main cause of most of the warming since the late 19th century. The majority of Australians believe global warming is happening. So, the Skeptics think that they have a right to hold a view that is not the majority of our community, which is why many of us have engaged in public debate and have called for the government to do something about global warming. These people are not people we are interested in debating or have a relationship with. We have no desire for this to become a story in the media about our views on global warming. If the truth is good enough for everyone, they should be good enough for us. They are not. The truth shall prevail. You can also hear the Skeptics' response on their recent appearance on The Big Ideas podcast with John Hiscock here.

The government of India recently made a decision to ban sale of all smartphones running Google's Android operating system. That is likely to affect Android-based devices used by the Indian mobile phone market. The move is reportedly made in line with India's decision to block import of Samsung's smartphones in India. India's move may be a reaction to the growing popularity of Apple's iPhone, according to the Economic Times. An Indian court has rejected Apple's application to import the iPhone 6 and iPhone 6 Plus into India in April, and then again in September, citing "anti-competition" reasons. The ruling was announced in the case, Appancom Pvt. Ltd. v. Union of India & Ors., which is awaiting trial in India. According to a report sent to The Wall Street Journal last month, Apple has been importing iPhones in India and selling them at a low price. Apple's iPhone sales to India are estimated to be around $1 billion per year. The smartphone market in India grew 13.3 percent to 50 million smartphones in 2014 from 41.6 million in 2011. Smartphones in India will become even more popular, as Apple's iPhone 6 and iPhone 6 Plus are expected to be the best sellers in India next year as Samsung's recent recall of its Galaxy Note 3 device, which was launched two years ago and sold very well, shows. Apple has not publicly commented on the decision or what the government of India has done about it, so it may be a combination of two things. Apple has not publicly commented on the decision to ban its phones on Indian soil. One possible reason: the Indian government does not actually own the patents for the iPhone 5 and iPhone 5c that Apple has been importing into the country from China, as that device is covered by a trade agreement for local telecommunications companies. The Indian government and trade partners do own the patents for two other iPhone models, which might have triggered the ban. The government's own rationale for the ban would be to protect manufacturers from foreign competition, something that Apple would want to avoid with its Android devices. The fact is, Indian manufacturers will not lose out to foreign companies in India. Indian consumers would be much better off when the government bans all imports of the Android devices into the country. Apple does not have an issue with Indian companies operating in Indian markets like Airtel or Idea. Apple actually has a strong presence in India. It sells iPhones in India, while Google sells many Indian smartphones on its Android app stores. The ban on Android-based smartphones seems more likely to affect the companies manufacturing devices that run on Google's smartphone operating system. The government of India probably thinks it is too difficult to operate a company making devices that run on a different operating system. The government of India seems to be trying to regulate Android devices to keep them off the country's markets, according to a report earlier this week. The same report said that the government's anti-competition department has launched a probe to determine whether Google's Android devices pose an "imminent threat" to Indian phone manufacturers. Apple has been operating Android devices in Asia for almost two decades and is a significant player in India; the company has a large Indian retail store network and provides a number of services such as a free voice and data plan to users. In March, Amazon.com Inc. reported that it shipped 1 million Prime members' items by way of Apple's iCloud service.

Cape Town - The EFF has made progress with its negotiations with the ANC, said MP Dennis du Plessis. "In the last six months we've seen some positive signs and I have to say there's some good news in the talks. There's still a long way to go, but we are moving towards a resolution," du Plessis told News24. "I believe what President Zuma [is] saying is that he is going to be very pragmatic in making any sort of decision to support democracy in South Africa. "We hope that that will show once and for all that the country will be a stable democracy." The EFF has called for three key demands in its negotiations with the ANC to resolve the issue of the Nkandla fire. The party would like to see increased transparency over the commissioning of the Nkandla fire; the commissioning of a full audit of the security in the presidency; and for the ANC to issue an unconditional apology to Eskom for the damage caused to one of its own substations. Du Plessis told News24 that he did not believe ANC officials did anything wrong, but the party was unwilling to address public outrage over the issue. Du Plessis said he welcomed the ANC agreeing to a "truth commission" in order to address the issue of the security breach in Nkandla which saw guards and vehicles being brought inside the home of President Jacob Zuma. Du Plessis also said the party wanted to hear from the president's chief of staff Mac Maharaj, and the defence department, on why the party believes the army did not respond properly when the situation at Nkandla appeared to be deteriorating. Nkandla is a sprawling golf course complex in Nkandla, in KwaZulu-Natal, near Durban. The complex is owned by the president and his family. The ANC's provincial executive committee has recently held its first conference in Durban, and will meet again in March to discuss its executive committee's plans for the party's state of play at the state level.

Samantha Bee has been on the warpath against Fox News since she was a guest on the cable news network's "Full Frontal" last October. During an interview with the hosts, the comedian slammed the cable channel and its hosts for being part of the "alt-right." "The big news we have in the last 10 days for our side in the [Trump] movement is that the Fox News Channel has decided to be more of an 'alt-right-friendly' kind of network, because that's all the Fox News channels are, right?" Bee said in the November 28 "Full Frontal" installment of her "Full Frontal" special. Bee has been speaking up against what she calls "fake news" outlets for some time. This was not the only time that Bee ripped on Fox News and its hosts for being part of the "alt-right." A recent episode of her web series "Full Frontal" featured her talking to "The O'Reilly Factor" host Bill O'Reilly about the network's ratings issues. She even went so far as to say that the network should cancel its weekend shows in favor of hosting "The Resistance Week." "You know the last 10 days are kind of scary." Bee said. "The Fox News Channel has lost 40 percent of their viewers since you came onto the air. Why? Because they are so much against our side." The two-time Emmy-nominated actress is not alone in her disdain for Fox News. A recent survey conducted by Public Policy Polling showed that Fox News was the most despised network in the country. The survey had 27 percent of respondents rating the network's programming positively and 33 percent saying the same about their view of Fox News, and another 27 percent who believed they had not even heard of the network. "The Fox News Channel is the single most powerful media asset in the GOP's arsenal. And it's not just the party apparatus that can't be swayed by a single Fox segment," said PPP researcher Michael Smith.

The United Nations said it will no longer accept Palestinian prisoners as interns in the organization, because of their participation in Hamas terror. "We don't need interns," said Dr. Peter Maurer, acting head of the Geneva-based International Committee of the Red Cross, at the World Union for Social Development's World Economic Forum in Abu Dhabi Tuesday. "They are prisoners of war. They have served their sentence. We have enough interns at home who can represent this organization for us. So we have decided that we will no longer accept interns," the UN humanitarian official explained. The UN agency's internship program, which is paid, currently has more than 2,000 interns, said Maurer. Palestinian prisoners and human-rights activists are calling for the suspension of internships, saying the practice is an "opportunity for abuse," according to the New York Times. Maurer added that some interns are "untrained and poorly trained" and "can't handle it, at least, not properly." Maurer also called for the UN to stop paying other countries "exorbitant" fees for its workers, in part because of the money it can be making out of the Palestinian Authority. It is believed the organization spends hundreds of thousands of dollars in each Palestinian intern. "How dare you take advantage of the Palestinian people!" Palestinian activists wrote on Facebook. "You are the murderers! You are terrorists! You are liars!" The UN is a key player in the Palestinian territories and has been criticized by both the Israeli authorities and Palestinians for allowing the continued operation of the Hamas terror group, which rules the Gaza Strip. The UN was also caught using children as "human shields" at a recent Gaza tunnel evacuation.

I have a confession. I know that no woman has ever told me she'd love to be a porn star. That's because I have no interest in being a porn star. I would never even consider it. But I'm not alone. There are millions of women who have the same thoughts, and who are waiting in the wings. And when it comes to porn, the industry has been notoriously bad about supporting, even acknowledging, the needs of women and sex workers. The porn website Pornhub recently published porn actresses' salaries. They were divided into three categories: top performers, most popular performers and the porn stars who "made their living" in the business. The top performers earned around $17,000 for performing in an average video. The women who "made their living" included the top women earning $30,000 or more. Porn stars who "made it" (even for a short time) earned less than the lowest average female performer and more than the highest average male performer. Porn stars who "made it" were those who made a certain amount of money—say $50,000—in a year. These women were deemed to be "bigger than the average girl," which in porn is often defined as being able to take care of her family or get a "guy." Despite the fact that women are at their sexiest during their menstrual cycle, they are also paid less than men who perform the exact same job. One website estimated that in 2010, women were compensated for their work in the industry at around $6,000 per scene. And the typical sex worker has sex four times a week, on average. A report by Prostitution Research and Education found that male performers who are paid an average of $35,000 per film and female performers who make an average of $15,000 per tape earn considerably more. One performer had to "work seven days a week and earn $300,000 just to make a decent salary," reported The Daily Beast in 2012. In 2010, a report by Prostitution Research and Education found that female performers who make an average of $15,000 per video and male performers who make between $10 and $20,000 per film earn considerably more. These are the types of numbers that most people might think would have women in a panic. But there's good reason for porn performers' salaries to be so low and hard to predict. Porn stars have long been expected to be less than perfect. "You can't ask a young girl to work with a camera on her face, and you can't expect sex with a camera to be the most arousing thing she's ever seen," one performer told me. One performer I interviewed, who had worked in porn for over 10 years, said, "There is no such thing as a 'real' porn star; you have to find one within [the parameters] dictated by your porn director." In the "real" world, men make more and women less. Sex workers aren't allowed to have lives outside the work they do. For many of them it's impossible to imagine being able to be any other job. In many states, they can be fired simply for being who they are. "This industry is an industry of slavery, and I refuse to be used as a commodity," a porn performer named Amber told me in 2011. "If people know about this industry, there are more options for you. You can be an accountant, a schoolteacher, a lawyer, etc. The fact that [the industry is] still around means that it's still being held in place by the same old men who created it, so you can expect to have the same conditions. And the people paying you have the right to be fucked and to be used as little as they want to you, so if you are dissatisfied with your position, you should find another job." This was a statement I heard repeatedly in my conversations with porn performers: Even if they were paid a fair wage, they would likely not find another job. That is the reality of the porn industry. But that wasn't my own experience. I grew up in a world without porn. Porn started to exist for me in high school, in the form of the porn videos my grandfather handed down from generation to generation. In the 1970s, when his father was still in the business, porn movies were shot in low-budget, amateur "amateur" movies. My grandfather was the only studio employee—the cinematographer, the assistant directors, everyone else was just a regular dude. When I was 18, I discovered porn for myself. I found my first scene on Pornhub. Within a few days, I had a thousand people hitting my "likes" page on Facebook. And I immediately knew I needed to get out of my town. BANGKOK — The United Nation's top human rights watchdog warned Thailand on Thursday that security forces had abused detainees under an intensified crackdown on dissent and the rights to privacy, association and peaceful assembly in a bid to curb the influence of the city's radical red shirt movement. As President Junta leader Prayuth Chan-ocha's government has pushed police and security forces to tighten their grip on public gatherings, the human rights office of the United Nations said it was concerned for the safety of the world's most populous nation as it pursues the Red Shirts. In a report that drew criticism from rights groups, the U.N. special rapporteur for human rights in Thailand said police had used "unlawful methods" and were using "discrete violations" to target the Red Shirts. The report said authorities had targeted Red Shirts who opposed the military government, but also used force against those who had peacefully gathered on a sidewalk and then moved into public spaces or blocked traffic. In some cases, those detained had had their homes raided without warrants or had their assets confiscated. "All the security forces in Thailand should immediately cease the use of unlawful means, including force, by exercising the utmost restraint and carrying out impartial investigations, in compliance with the law," it said. "The special rapporteur urges the Thai authorities to take immediate measures to prevent and to redress all violations of the right to assembly." The U.N. report came after the human rights rapporteurs on Tuesday expressed severe concern for the safety of a lawyer and a political activist detained in the city of Pathum Thani, south of Bangkok, because of suspicions they were members of the Red Shirts. Both men were released. Police and other security forces have also detained demonstrators there, and an Amnesty International statement said they were being used by the military as "human shields." Security forces are conducting sweeping sweeps of Bangkok and other major cities in what analysts say appears to be a crackdown on the Red Shirts. The United Nations report called for a swift investigation into the deaths and torture of detainees, saying the government's initial response "has been inadequate" and the "systemic failures of the law enforcement authorities" must be addressed. It made eight recommendations, including creating a mechanism to protect rights activists from harassment and intimidation by the security forces. The report came a day after a Red Shirts member was killed outside of Bangkok's Victory Monument over the weekend in the latest wave of bloodshed and repression of the movement. More than 40 Red Shirt supporters were arrested in Bangkok on Wednesday after the demonstration. The Red Shirts have sought to distance themselves from violence, saying they have no affiliation with members of the outlawed Red Shirts Battah political group, which is closely linked to the red shirts. But several deaths and several attacks since 2008, including two at military-government rally sites last year, have implicated Red Shirts and the red shirts. The Thai police have previously said that they were concerned about the impact on tourism if Red Shirts supporters were able to gather in large numbers in key locations across the nation. A recent decision by the government to close off Bangkok's famous Chao Phraya Riverfront to foot traffic has complicated security plans. Protesters are also concerned about the safety of foreigners in downtown Bangkok, saying they feel vulnerable when they walk the street. U.N. officials said one of Thailand's most prominent opposition politicians, Suthep Thaugsuban, will go on trial later this month after being charged with insurrection, leading violence and conspiracy against the state. He has rejected the charges as politically motivated. Mr. Suthep, who faces allegations he helped plan the 2007 coup that ousted Thailand's elected government, has frequently criticized the military and the government. Mr. Prayuth, the former army chief, has defended his government's crackdown on the Red Shirts and said the Red Shirts "are dangerous people, so we have to deal with them." Critics have accused the military-run government of attempting to destroy the opposition movement through a relentless campaign of arrests since it came to power in the 2014 coup. The U.N. report called on authorities to ensure there was a speedy trial and to provide sufficient space for any potential appeal of the case of Mr. Suthep, which would go to the country's highest court. "The United Nations will continue to closely follow the situation of the case of Suthep Thaugsuban," the report said. The U.N. also called on the Thai authorities "to immediately permit independent observers to observe the trial at all stages and to provide guarantees that the trial be conducted in a fair manner, that all due process rights are respected, the accused have an effective right to defence, and all proceedings are conducted in a manner which promotes public confidence in the security forces." The government on Thursday dismissed the criticism of the crackdown, with national security spokesman Maj. Gen. P

In a few days or months you might get some of the coolest equipment you can carry. I've written a few posts about the stuff. I've had a chance to see an AR15 build and even see what someone had built and test fire it at SRA. But today I'm going to be showing you how to build your own light stand using a piece of 2×4. It only takes 20 minutes and requires no skills. I'll show you the equipment and method I used, but the stand was built and tested by a guy named Mark in the comments, if you can spare the time and want to learn a little more about this, here's a link. What You Need I have to be honest — I don't want to write something this time of year just to do it. I'd rather focus on the future and things that are on the horizon. But, there are so many incredible new projects, tools, and gear that are just out there. So, I thought I'd do my duty, and share a few items that I've been using. 1. I need three 3/8″ wood screws. 2. I need a metal screw. If you don't have one in your house, you can get 3/16″ metal screws from Amazon. I don't have any specific ones. 3. You need drill bits (any variety will work, you only need about 9-12). How It Works What you've got here is a 2×10 frame and two 2×4 pieces. The frame uses 4 1/8″ screws on one side and 10 1/4″ screws on the other side. The middle 4 1/8″ screws that come together lock them into place. Now, you can use a piece of 1×6 that's long enough to wrap around the middle of the frame and screw them in place. This works pretty well for me, but you can also just lay the frame flat on a table and screw everything in with screws. You can also just cut a piece off the end of a 2×12 shelf that has two 1″ shelf brackets. I'd probably just get a large 4 1/8″ piece of board for this. I found these screws on a Home Depot site called Amazon. I bought all three sizes and I ended up having a couple leftover (they were only $1 each). You may find cheaper screws, but if you want a strong and rigid setup you're going to need the best. I cut out all of the 3/8″ wood board I needed to fit the 2×4s and assembled everything to see what it looked like: The parts I cut out fit well together and there should be enough clearance to put the battery and charging cable through. I'll show some pictures of how I did that later. In order to hold the batteries, I put a 1.5″ diameter foam board in the corners of the frame and cut out 1/4″ plywood on the backside to act as a backing. The boards need to be close together so they don't collapse. There probably could have been an easier way here, but I really didn't want to screw it all in because that would make it really heavy (if it even would). I only screwed in the bottom 1/4″. Next, I took an 18 inch long 2×4 and cut it up into four 4′ length (it was 2×4 and 2×6 at the same time and this allowed me to reuse 1/4″ bolts and go with 16-18″ long boards). I put all of the 4′ boards into a 3/4″ plywood frame, then I took one 1/4″ plywood and cut it up into two 1/4″ boards. I screwed all four pieces together. I also cut 2″ pieces of 1/4″ plywood that were 6″ long to cover the front side of the batteries. The bottom of the battery compartment needs to be able to accommodate the cable. Because you're only going to put a small 3.6V battery in here (if anything at all) there isn't a lot of room for cables going into the top. To solve that problem I used 4 1/8″ plastic cable ties. This was one of the cheaper and simpler cable ties you can get. You can try something cheaper or something more complicated. I bought them on Amazon. I just put a bunch of them on each corner (to tie everything together) and went to town. And that's kinda it! Now I have a complete, ready to shoot light stand that won't break the bank and could be easily modified and added to a lot of other pieces. It's a great little lightweight light stand and could be a good way to get started with DIY. I've been using this from day one on my AR-15 and it's just as

Hugh Jackman has a lot of catching up to do. There's the new The Wolverine, and then the upcoming X-Men: Days of Future Past, which stars Jackman as Wolverine and Patrick Stewart as Professor X. Plus, the studio just finished wrapping production on the new X-Force. So that has to take some time, too. So what does the actor like to do when he's not making blockbusters like these? As a new Daily Show video points out, Jackman is a big fan of riding a skateboard, and he even rides a skateboard with a camera in it: "You just think of a lot of things when you're on a skateboard, but you have to look up and see everything on the board," Jackman said in the video. "And we always get a real kick out of the stunt guys. They're absolutely ridiculous, like, 'I can't believe you've done that, that's the biggest one you've ever done, come here and take pictures.'" But it was the fact that Jackman's wearing a GoPro that really piqued the attention of the video. "So, one of the cool things about the skateboard is they use the cam and it goes around your back," Jackman said. "So, when you're on a board it's a little bit like a surfboard where you're not really on the board so much of it's kind of your hands pushing it." Here's to hoping that skateboard footage from the forthcoming movie The Wolverine gets posted on YouTube by Jackman — but it'll have to wait until May. (via Daily Mail)

In the wake of Hurricane Harvey, San Antonio has a clear message for the federal government. City leaders held a press conference Wednesday afternoon as they asked the Army Corps of Engineers to reconsider its decision to deny their request for emergency federal funds. "It's heartbreaking, it's heart-rending it's ridiculous it's beyond words. And today, we have a chance to turn the page," Mayor Ron Nirenberg said. The Mayor says his City of Refuge was supposed to help communities recover from major disasters like Harvey but it's gotten much more than that. "Today, we've gotten a chance to turn the page and move off and do what the people of this state want us to do – be prepared for future disasters," Nirenberg said. According to the City of Refuge, the $100 million in federal money to help the City of Refuge recover from Harvey will help the City rebuild homes and pay for other expenses after Harvey. The City of Refuge would like to get the money from the United States Army Corps of Engineers and Nirenberg wants to use some of that money to help with the recovery efforts for Houston. Mayor Nirenberg is calling for an emergency meeting with the Army Corps of Engineers to see if there is a way forward. It should not take a federal disaster for Houston to rebuild. They are ready for it.

The World Rugby Sevens Series, held every three years, is an annual rugby international competition that combines the best rugby Sevens players from around the world. Teams from countries such as New Zealand, Australia, USA and the United Kingdom compete across four different divisions to score as many points as possible in a season that lasts only ten days. The series takes place under the World Rugby World Series banner. Format World Rugby Sevens Series tournaments are run as a knockout stage with teams competing for one of three separate prize pools: Top seed Participants in pool 1 qualify for semifinals Pool 2 plays in the other semifinal Pool 4 makes up the final Pool 1 Participants in pool 1 qualify for semifinals Pool 2 plays in the other semifinal Pool 4 makes up the final Pool 1 First Place The winner is awarded the prize pool, with any other teams that reach the semis receiving a bye in the semifinals Teams The World Rugby Sevens Series is played out across two categories of teams: men's and women's. Men's Series The men's series is an all-World Rugby Sevens Series tournament, played between October and December in a double-header format. This format features the first stage of the series, a round robin stage, followed by the second stage, a quarter-finals stage. Semifinals and Finals The round robin stage of the tournament is the first stage of the tournament. Semi-finals The semifinals feature top seeds, with winners from each division seeded into the semifinals. Pool play will continue with teams battling over pool 1 and pool 2 positions, with winners from each pool taking on the other in the winners' quarterfinals and championship. The winners of the semis play in the top seeds' semifinals. Championshames All the matches in the competition are played in September, starting in Melbourne on the weekend after the final tournament. The winners of each pool will play in a quarter-final, while the losers, after receiving the least number of points, fight for a place in the final. Afterwards, the quarter-finals and championship are played in Glasgow with the team with the most points winning the title. Women's Series In contrast to the men's series, the women's series has six teams (United Kingdom, Australia, New Zealand, South Africa, USA and the Republic of Ireland) competing across three separate divisions. The women's division also introduces the concept of a knockout stage with teams qualifying for the playoffs based on a maximum number of points. Participants The World Rugby Sevens Series sees 16 women's teams join 12 men's teams in 12 countries for the competition. Teams are divided geographically based on seven points, with teams based on the Caribbean and South Pacific islands earning more points. The format of the women's tournament allows for greater individual variation and increased player interaction between teams. Teams in each division have nine players, whereas for each men's team, there is only allowed 10. Women and men are placed in separate groups at the start of the competition to maximise the amount of time available for training, with each team having three matches total. Format The tournament is played during September with an additional round of qualifying before the tournament commences in Glasgow in September 2018. Winning teams Each year the seven-team, knockout tournament features four semi-finalist and two winners and runners-up. Final stage The final stage of the season sees teams compete in nine group stages to qualify for the postseason where the winners in pool play take on runners-up in the championship. Schedule The World Rugby World Series is played in a round robin format with the top four sides in each division competing, all the way to the final. October: Championship Quarter Finals December: Semi-finals February: Championship Finals April: Playoffs Venue The World Rugby Sevens Series takes place at a combination of venues across 12 countries, from Scotland to South Africa and Australia to New Zealand. Scheduled dates and venues (all times are local): Australia, Canada, New Zealand, England, France, Ireland, Ireland, Italy, Japan, Scotland, Wales, Scotland, Wales, Wales, Wales. Tickets Buy tickets for the W7S Series. Fixtures The schedule for each edition of the Women's World Rugby Sevens Series 2018/2019 can be viewed below.

A few years ago, I took a day trip from Portland, Oregon, to Bali. I was excited to do some hiking, have a few hours at a resort, and relax in the sun. What I didn't realize, when I got out of the airplane and crossed the border into Bali, was that I would be spending a lot of time in the company of women on that trip. Bali's beautiful beaches were full of young women who were so much more attractive, graceful, and fun to be around. And yet, Bali was also extremely conservative; it's hard to find a place you can relax and live my life, and relax and live freely when a woman can't be around. That's why it's so important that Bali's tourism industry is male-dominated. The tourism industry has a huge business in female clientele, because women are known to travel more on their own and get to know people more. Bali has only one night spa, and the only woman in business whose name I can find working in it is the owner's daughter. The rest of the business is male. So, the men get to do pretty much whatever they want: They can get a massage, go to the beach, or go snorkeling if they love the sea. And they can also get the best deals of any tourist destination anywhere, while women are stuck trying to find a massage parlor in a place where there are literally no male masseurs. The irony of this situation was not lost on me. After I arrived in Bali, I visited all the places I was told were "good" for women, but I didn't find any of those places. I didn't find massage parlors, I didn't find women's lingerie shops, I didn't even find bars where men could have a drink and talk about women to me. The city in search of the ideal female face, has found itself surrounded by people who know exactly where that face is supposed to be. But the other side of that coin is that women have much higher standards for places they visit on their own. Bali is pretty liberal here, and yet, the women and I couldn't find a single place to get a massage or take a dip while we were there. The only place with decent women's products seemed to offer an average massage, and that was a bit of a disappointment after I had gone to other places in the area that were much more affordable. So I came to the conclusion that Bali tourism is a business built around the needs of men: Women in Bali don't want to go there or feel comfortable there; the places that women come to need to feel inviting to women, and must also be easy to get to, and most importantly, must cater to everyone except women. If I wanted to have a good time in Bali, all I had to do was stop getting my hair braided in Bali, and no one would have been the wiser. And because most of the hotels in Bali are men's-owned and operated, no one even seems to know that they aren't the best options for women. It's as if no one wants female customers. I spent all day thinking about how all this played out in my own life. It was my first time to visit Bali, so I had a good feeling about the place. I was excited that there was something new to see, new art, fresh cuisine, new experiences from the island. But in the end, I discovered that Bali is a men's adventure capital.

A "man-shaped" device which can turn electricity and light in the air into motion has been described as the "most beautiful" device to emerge from the field of "crystal manipulation techniques". The tiny device generates electricity when heat is applied, and that same heat can generate light. The discovery suggests that the properties of quantum physics, the fundamental underpinning of physics, may hold promise for transforming energy sources. The work is described as "truly brilliant science", by one of its creators. "The most beautiful device of its kind to emerge from the field of crystal manipulation techniques is described and the method of generation of heat is explained as to why the heat is generated," said Professor Eric Klopfer from the University of Waterloo in Canada, who led the work. I'm always delighted when the opportunity to interview a game designer who is active in community outreach. When you have the opportunity to have the designer show us some of his or her work at a conference we take it. It's like having time with an old friend and hearing them reminisce. With that in mind, I was recently contacted by the talented folks who run the blog, and who also run a very generous Patreon, Gamers Heroes, to interview one of the most visible members of the gaming community – Jon Gilmour. The interview has been lightly edited for length, so go ahead and read it if you have some time on your hands. How did you come to be a games designer? Were you into board games in high school? Any interests in other games? Jon Gilmour: This is a good question – I never played a game I made until college. I was interested in computers at birth though, and by the time I got older I took up computers for work, not gaming. I made a basic "toy computer" when I was 12, in hopes that it might be of use someday (I was a math major, so I would have had to figure out a way to play it). It took me a couple of years to try programming, then I picked up other computer arts as a hobby. Do you think your current work influences other designers? Do you see similarities in the work you do? Gilmour: I have no control over what other designers do, and I didn't do it for this kind of influence, even though I have a deep appreciation for how other people might work, not only for design but for game design as a whole. I find my influences to be many, including games like Myst (which influenced early games like Ultima), King's Quest, The Bard's Tale and of course SimCity, all of which I enjoy, and that have influenced me enormously over the years. In fact the way one of my recent games has managed to find success (aside from not being a "soul crushing" simulation game like everything else out there…) was pretty remarkable… it wasn't anything I'd written explicitly or consciously. So, what do you consider your favorite games to work on, or your favorite game companies to be working with? If you're working with someone, what does that mean and how does working with that particular person affect your design process? Gilmour: As far as games going, I think what I'm happiest about is getting the chance to create unique experiences. I'll be honest, it can be a challenge, and I want to keep pushing myself to find new ways of solving those problems. I also find the process of working with companies with interesting challenges. The fact, that there always seems to be something new to work on, and yet never to know what it's going to be until you see it in development, makes it a good place to get into as a designer, and to try out concepts. So, what's next for you? Where are you working in terms of game design and publishing? Will you ever design a game of your own? Gilmour: I really enjoy working with other designers. One of the ways I've approached my work since I started is to put out an idea and find out if other people are interested in what it is. I think the idea, and I hope the people who are interested in it, will find a way to combine my experience with theirs in order that my ideas become reality. My current project, called HAWT is a game that is inspired by a lot of things – a lot of different games, and a little bit of some more recent and "tribal" games. It's about a warrior in the midst of an assault on a tower that holds an enormous stone block. The player is trying to survive, to get through the onslaught of various enemies. I think if anyone has an interested in doing something similar, there's a lot of interesting ways to make it feel distinctive, unique, and "mechanical". Do you feel you've come a long way since the very first video game you wrote about, "I'm the King of Everything!", but have you found it difficult to stay within the realm of your art and still work as a programmer and designer? Gilmour: Oh man – it's crazy just how much I've worked. I've been around games since I was in college, even more now. I have a full time software development job, working on a couple different things that never quite come to fruition. There is often a great feeling that comes with having achieved something, but the more I play video games, and play the games I make it's always hard to resist those little "hints to something else" that keep hitting my head. The main difficulty has always been that it's difficult to make games that are as technically impressive as we would like them to be.

I always felt that the best way for me to play this game was against guys I knew had a high ceiling, Matthews replied. "And I know that was a part of my life, especially when I was playing for the University of North Carolina and going through the ACC. Obviously, I got into the league and I played against a lot of great players like Steph Curry, Tony Allen, Chris Paul, all those guys. I went to their games and it taught me about myself. All of those guys had their own way of playing the game, they always found something good to do on the court. With the Spurs, all I knew was that I could be a good player at this level and I could make my teammates better."

To all of the people who have told me to stay in school, I've told them to go fuck themselves, she replied to a question on her Twitter account today. A spokesperson, from the Labour Party, said: "We have taken the decision to stand down from our role at the General Election because the Labour Party will not be entering into another coalition with the Conservatives. We believe the best way to end austerity and bring an end to years of Tory chaos is a strong Labour Government." Shadow chancellor John McDonnell, who was tipped to be the party's future leader, said: "We will only be entering into a coalition with the Tories if it delivers a clear mandate from the British people to run our economy and borrow our way out of this mess. "Labour will work with other parties who share our values of social justice, strong public services and a fairer economy, to end the Tories' economic failure and bring change to our country. "Labour will stand up to the Tories, fight them over tax credits and stand up for the poorest in our society." Mr McDonnell said Labour was "not yet" ready to reveal its manifesto, or even provide "any detail on where we will find the £20bn we need to deliver a decent job and secure a secure retirement" but said that the party "will not be offering empty promises". He said Mr Cameron has "failed" over his deficit reduction pledges, and added: "We'll be providing a stronger, fairer society with a strong economy. The Tories don't get it - they are just pretending that they do." It comes as the Conservatives say they plan to double investment in the military to tackle the "deficit crisis" - yet have not provided details of their £36bn defence budget. The manifesto states the Armed Forces will "grow substantially", but it does not provide details as to how new spending is to be made. Shape Created with Sketch.
