The new year is here (it's time to be grateful and joyful, you know)! So how can we start a new year off right? By making our annual resolutions and, of course, by trying to reach our goal of losing at least a pound of fat a week. That's right, it's time to get serious. You have the power over your life. And every day, you can choose to get the things that you want. The truth is that most of the things that make you feel like failures in life or worse, unattractive, are simply habits. Habits that you can change, at any time. That's how I got motivated to lose weight. When I realized that I was unable to change what I liked and disliked about my body, I decided in 2010 to try something radical: To take my body out of the equation completely. What I mean by radical is that I was going to eat as I like, regardless of what other people were eating. I wanted to live by my own rules, and let the rest of the world eat whatever they liked. That's what I called a No-Calorie Diet (NCD) and it turned out to be a game changer for my health. I lost an amazing 10 pounds in a very short period of time. This was the result of my focus on taking good care of myself and taking action. I was very skeptical about how it would impact my life, but I kept it up for two whole months, doing nothing but eating normally. And I saw incredible results: I became happier, I went from being a 35-inch waist to a more acceptable 35-16.3. The only side effect that I noticed was that I felt really good about myself, which is just as important as losing weight. Now, I realize that my experience isn't representative of everyone: some people need food to live. Some people like junk food. And some people don't even eat for pleasure. There's no harm in any of it, as long as you're making conscious decisions to be healthy. But I want to inspire people to be a different kind of human — to be motivated by their health even if it sounds crazy. Maybe you're an extremely successful person, where you're able to eat what you want without losing any weight. Or you can be a sloth, who doesn't care about food at all. Whatever the case, you can be the person you want to be by getting into the habit of taking healthy actions. Here's how: Choose not to worry: One of the hardest things to do as an unhealthy person is to realize that we can't control everything that happens to us. If we focus on how much weight we gained or lost, we will never be motivated to change that. In the past, I've worked with people who suffered from binge eating disorder — and, quite honestly, those people are the ones who get motivated to lose weight since they realize that they won't have "their thing" if they keep being fat. But it also helps to be less worried about how much weight we want, or what others eat. Let your body go in whatever direction it wants to go: We often try to make ourselves accountable for things like weight, but let your body take the lead. It's your body and that's what it wants. Some people prefer exercise for health, others for their mental health. Do whatever works for you, and let your body do those things. You don't control how much exercise or weight you put on, so please do only that which you're comfortable with and you won't regret. Focus on the good: While not eating is great, the most important thing that's going on in your life — or your body's — is that you're healthy. Even if the bad stuff was going on with the food you choose to eat, all you can control is your health. And the good stuff? Well, all you can control is how you think. The next time you find yourself looking at a beautiful picture or something great you've done, remind yourself that it was because of all your good decisions. Let that be your motivation to take better care of yourself. Have fun and be positive: Life is going to be challenging and even frustrating. But it won't be anything you can't handle — it's going to be beautiful and fun and rewarding. Don't worry, though. And the best way to have fun in life is to focus on enjoying yourself. So make an effort to enjoy everything, and don't worry about the negative things. Life is a marathon, not a sprint. If you keep your mind on the positive and don't let negative thoughts make you nervous, you can overcome any situation. Remember that you can still do it: I have been saying for years that you can't beat your body in the game of life, but I have also always believed that you can

The idea for this video came from watching my daughters walk around the house. The idea was this is the way to teach your kids that the world is real and that everything that they see that is not real is only a mirage, and just a movie, or a dream. A lot of times I am surprised by what kids see around them and it really shocks me. I think it's just the children's way of understanding the world. My daughter would walk around the house telling me that the house was haunted. She wouldn't know how to explain to me how she'd seen something that isn't there, but I didn't know how to explain to her what she saw. That's how I learned that these things are only dreams, and only the imagination of the kids. I think that's a lesson that should be learned for all of us. Children have a heightened understanding of the world; that is why they need to be taught this lesson early. Do you think this is a good video to show your kids?? Comments comments

An international team led by scientists at Queen Mary University of London has studied evidence of an unusual, rapid rise in sea level over the last 3,500 years. This rapid response has been traced to a sudden weakening of the eastern North Atlantic ridge, which was originally built to help prevent sea levels from rising. This event may have triggered rapid volcanic eruptions in Iceland at about the same time. Over the last 2,000 years, the north Atlantic ridge has continued to weaken, but it did so too slowly to allow sea levels to begin a long period of decrease, which is what was thought to have happened in the 20th Century. The team, which is reporting its findings today at the Royal Society, used the volcanic record from Iceland and the Antarctic ice sheet to trace a single event, that of an abrupt loss of strength in the ridge, occurring in 1275 AD, and to investigate the consequences in time. The scientists were also able to reconstruct a more complex sequence of events that took place in the middle of the last glacial maximum, which lasted until about 20,000 years ago. The results have important implications for understanding the dynamics of the Atlantic and Pacific Oceans during the Last Glacial Maximum. It could also help to explain an unprecedented sea level drop in the last century. The researchers used detailed modelling techniques to trace one small phase of the event, which may have started immediately before 1275. They then considered the effects that the eruption of Mount St Helens had on the Atlantic. They concluded that it likely contributed to a drop in sea levels by causing an increasing tilt in the crust. This caused the ridge to buckle, and the ridge has continued to weaken ever since. "The rapid strengthening of the ridge was triggered because it broke down suddenly," explains Dr David Naylor-Clarke, the project leader from the Geographer's department at QMUL. "For that to happen we're going to need to think about some very dramatic eruptions in Iceland during this period. "We've never seen any volcanic eruption at Iceland from this time period, so it's interesting to look at this period when it's so different." Scientists have been able to follow the development of the Atlantic ridge since the end of the last glacial maximum about 12,000 years ago. In that time it has weakened a small amount but gradually declined in strength. The study revealed that the ridge weakened within minutes, even though the rate at which this is happening has fluctuated over the last 10,000 years. The team suggest that this sudden weakening may also have been associated with a volcanic eruption that took place at about the same time. Dr Naylor-Clarke's group has now used the same modelling tools to analyse several other episodes of rapid sea level rise over the last 3,500 years. ### "Global patterns in sea level rise of the last 3,500 years," by Naylor-Clarke (QMUL) and others is available as an open access article ahead of print on Geobiology.

A man stands on top of a burnt-out car near the Eiffel Tower in Paris at the moment of the attacks on Friday. Photo: AP A woman stands in front of flowers near the Bataclan concert hall. Photo: AP French President Francois Hollande visits the Bataclan concert hall with Paris prosecutor François Molins. Photo: AP A man lies next to flowers at the French Embassy in Brussels. Photo: AFP Police officers gather at the scene of a hostage situation near the Stade de France. Photo: AP Women and children walk at the Bataclan concert hall. Photo: AP A police officer stands guard at the Eiffel Tower. Photo: AP PARIS — Two of four hostages shot dead in Paris on Friday are among five people killed in the capital on Friday evening. Two men who were shot dead inside a car in a Parisian suburb died of their injuries, a judicial source said. Another person was shot in the leg. The man shot in Montrouge is dead. The judicial source told Associated Press that the fourth victim, a 35-year-old woman, wasn't a hostage. She was at a bar on the Avenue Montparnasse before she was shot and died. The source said two victims were among five people killed in northern Paris -- a 34-year-old man and his pregnant girlfriend. In another incident, a man died after his car exploded near Boulevard Voltaire in northern Paris just before 8 p.m. (11 a.m. ET), according to the Paris prosecutor general's office. It wasn't clear if the man was a pedestrian or a driver of the car who was using the vehicle as a getaway vehicle. The explosion occurred near the corner of the street where four other people were killed in the city on Friday evening, said Paris Prosecutor Francois Molins. An official at the prosecutor's office in Paris said early Saturday that authorities were looking into whether the explosion was terrorist or arson. According to the French Interior Ministry, the first explosion occurred on the Rue de Rivoli where a woman was fatally shot and injured. A passerby then detonated an explosive device on a car in front of the building, injuring another. The official also said that the car used in the explosions was a white Fiat Panda hatchback that had been hijacked in Strasbourg, France, early Saturday. Police took two people into custody when they arrived at the scene in the city of about 40,000 located southeast of Paris. Police closed the streets in the area around the Paris prosecutor's office and the Eiffel Tower, where President François Hollande was attending a concert featuring U2. Police officials say the bombings were not related to the attacks on Friday. One person was killed in a suicide attack outside the French Embassy in the city of Nice, France, on Friday, the French Interior Ministry said in a statement late Saturday. The attacker detonated an explosive device near the main entrance of the building, the ministry said. Three explosions were also heard Friday night at the Stade de France in Paris, one at the end of a soccer match and another shortly before it ended, according to the French Interior Ministry. Two people were killed and dozens were wounded in three blasts in Paris. The explosions caused no lasting structural damage and the explosions were not linked to attacks on Friday against the satirical newspaper Charlie Hebdo, the national soccer team of France or the U.S. Consulate. In other attacks, three explosions were blamed on a man trying to steal a soldier's uniform in the eastern Paris suburb of Dammartin-en-Goele on Friday night. No one was wounded. Two people were seriously injured in the attack, said Interior Minister Bernard Cazeneuve. France had been on high alert since Wednesday when two Islamist gunmen killed 20 people on the Champs-Elysees in what was the deadliest attack against French tourists since November 2015. The terrorists shouted "Allahu akbar" during the hostage takings. The manhunt for the two perpetrators led police to an industrial area of northern Paris from where the assault was planned. France is under a state of emergency after the attacks, which the state of emergency was extended a third time earlier. On Sunday, a security manhunt is ongoing for suspected terrorists who have attacked in Paris. Police carried out several raids across Paris, according to the French Interior Ministry. Prime Minister Manuel Valls warned that there was "no limit to what could happen in France" and warned of the "grave" impact on families and for tourism.

The man was also arrested on a warrant accusing him of burglary and assault with intent to commit robbery, police said. A 29-year-old man charged with burglarizing a home near the White Horse Reservoir is being held at the Clark County Detention Center after police say he broke into the home to get his dog, and his girlfriend was in the house at the time. The man was already in jail under an unrelated bail-beating case. He was charged with burglary and assault with intent to commit robbery after he was pulled over in the early morning hours Aug. 11 for driving with a suspended license. The Clark County Detention Center records also show that the man, who is homeless, was arrested five times over four years on warrants for violating his probation. In March 2011, he was charged with unlawful possession of marijuana after cops said he used marijuana during his probation. He also had four charges of violating his probation between 2002 and early 2010, including charges of resisting an officer by flight, failing to obey a lawful order by a peace officer, obstructing an officer and possessing drug paraphernalia. Then in late 2011, he was charged with interfering with a school employee. The charges stem from an incident in which he was allegedly found drunk inside his pickup truck in a school parking lot. He was later found guilty of those charges. Police now aren't sure why the man did it, but they say he is known to have threatened to kill himself. The suspect is in jail without bail and will be held until he is extradited to San Diego.

What a great year this has been for the city of Columbus, that we may get to make a run back to the MLS Cup Final, it can at least start here. This year, in our own backyard, we were able to watch a young boy born into the best soccer community in the world have one of his greatest days ever by scoring one of the greatest goals of his life. It took an incredible player who knew exactly what was going to happen before he took aim. It's like nothing else I have seen in terms of emotion. A goal is scored and the crowd screams and hollers in pure joy, you realize just how rare moments like these are. As a Columbus fan, I am absolutely honored by all of this. In a few weeks, the season ends for this team, we will go on to play Montreal Impact for the USL Cup and we will hopefully get to see the club make one of the many run to the top of the Eastern Conference. The good folks at New Era have made some special, limited edition shirts for the event. If you can not attend this week, or perhaps if you are just too damn old to go out, this is the shirt you want. Be sure to follow #CincyTakeOver on Twitter and Facebook for the full story, as well as pictures and videos from the event!

It was the most exciting first day at the job I've ever worked in. I had just been hired to work in the department of the office of a former high school student who had recently left college. He was about to begin a major in business administration. The previous guy was leaving for the night in the middle of the day, and I immediately thought, "Wow, that'll be the first of many moments I won't get to say 'Hi' to the man I'll work with for the next half an hour." I had just been hired to work in the department of the office of a former high school student who had recently left college. He was about to begin a major in business administration. The previous guy was leaving for the night in the middle of the day, and I immediately thought, "Wow, that'll be the first of many moments I won't get to say 'Hi' to the man I'll work with for the next half an hour." This first day of working with a new college freshman was like an exciting ride to the top of my high school dream ride — except no one saw me coming. The other first day I worked in a professional office was different. I got to say "Hi" to all the people I'd known in college. My old classmates, who I hadn't spoken to since I was in high school. My senior school social life was over. I started a job at a firm where I could finally be who I truly was, and what I'd always wanted to be: an adult. At a glance, these two experiences were very different, but what they share in common is the power of communication. How can you communicate with strangers to build trust, or to share a mutual appreciation for how much they mean to you? The right questions First, the right questions, to establish your connection. When you're first starting out as a new employee, or an intern, the most valuable skill you can have is confidence in your abilities and how you're likely to interact. When someone asks you a question, first focus on answering their question. "I'm really eager to learn," I used to say as an opening line. I figured if someone wanted to ask about the industry that they worked in, I knew which questions they could follow and which ones I couldn't. Now, I have a simple, direct and friendly way of greeting everyone I meet. It also makes me look much more friendly, and not like a stooge. So, here are the five questions you want to ask someone: "What do you do?" "What do you like to do?" "Why do you want to work here?" "How will you help me develop more experience?" "What can I do for you?" What if they don't know? I've always felt that if you just say something that you're good at, regardless of the truth, they'll be more comfortable speaking about it. If I say I work in human resources, then they're more comfortable talking about that with me. It's like they know I'm comfortable talking about their strengths with them. Even if someone doesn't know the answer to your question and you're looking to develop that trust and connection with someone, don't be afraid to get their name, so they can let you know if you've reached out to them in the past.

It was a strange sight at the NFL draft Thursday for Steelers receiver JuJu Smith-Schuster : His parents were in the stands, ready to welcome his arrival. The day began at a home in Virginia for some of Smith-Schuster's close family members and several childhood friends. The family also made the drive from Pittsburgh to Indianapolis for the NFL draft. "It's really cool to be in an NFL locker room with my guys," Smith-Schuster said in a conference call to discuss his draft selection by the Steelers. "It's really cool to not know (what's ahead), just be around and hang with them. "It's going to be a great experience, a great opportunity, but just to be around all my best friends from high school, from college when I was there." Smith-Schuster's mother, Nicole, was in the front row, cheering for her son. As his father stood on the edge of the front row waving his arms, it was difficult for him to keep up and kept from laughing. That would not be the first time some of this family's close friends have joined Smith-Schuster in a draft room. Smith-Schuster's father attended his first pro day in college and Nicole made multiple trips in the days leading up to the draft in February. She knew her son would be chosen well before her. They had met with coach Mike Tomlin, general manager Kevin Colbert and general manager Kevin Colbert's father, Andy, on multiple visits earlier in the week. "I was really proud of how he handled things and showed us and our teammates he's a humble guy," Smith-Schuster said. "That kind of stuck with me the whole way up here and going all the way. It's going to be tough but I'm ready to go." His father was also surprised that his son went to West Virginia over USC. "I wanted him to go to USC, but it didn't really matter," JuJu said. "Coach (Paul) Wulff had a great relationship with (former Steelers offensive coordinator) Todd Haley and the people at USC and he really wanted to be there for them but it didn't work out. They (the coaching staff) gave me the option. "And they were the second team in the draft so I was happy I made the decision. I was thankful for the decision because Coach Wulff gave me a chance and it worked out." There is little doubt where Smith-Schuster has been the most dedicated of all college players. He worked hard to get in better shape during his first season but felt it was too late. That changed last June. He moved into his high school's dorm building as a ninth-grader for a month at a time, working out in the weight room before the entire team came to his room for workouts. He'd spend his lunch break in the cafeteria, working on his nutrition, and it helped him gain some weight around the same time during the season. In a season where he caught 69 passes for 1,054 yards and 14 touchdowns in 13 games, he also had to deal with the fact that his quarterback, JuJu, had a broken collarbone with one game to play. "They didn't want us to start slow like (Washington running back) Chris Thompson and do a lot of damage to our team," Tomlin said of JuJu, referring to last season's No. 6-ranked rushing team. "We felt like there was a chance in the NFL. You can never take too much time off because it could turn into injury. He's an exciting player and has all the tools to become an established pro." But despite that, Smith-Schuster said he wasn't disappointed he didn't go higher than a round later. It was never about the money, but he wanted to play football, and he wanted to make the most of it. "There was no question for me on how I feel about JuJu being draft," said receiver Sammie Coates. "This is JuJu Smith-Schuster we're talking about, not, 'OK, let's go get a few more yards.' It was him who decided he was going to do that and he did it in a positive way. "When he steps on the football field, he has all the tools to be productive. When our offensive line does what they're supposed to do, we're one of the top offenses in the league." Pittsburgh general manager Kevin Colbert acknowledged that he and his colleagues went in knowing that not all is well in the running back room, which was supposed to have two rookie starters, Dalvin Cook and Samaje Perine. Smith-Schuster's father, a former offensive lineman for Texas, was the starter in 2014 before getting hurt. However, Smith-Schuster said it was an added bonus when he

It was inevitable. While it was widely believed that Donald Trump Jr. could've been in some serious legal trouble if he gave up the incriminating emails between himself and Rob Goldstone, that may be premature. The Daily Caller reports that a "recent source" tells them that Trump Jr. is not expected to face additional legal repercussions, despite a federal grand jury being impaneled to investigate him and the Trump team's ties to Russia. Specifically, the source says that there's only the possibility of criminal charges for "willful violation of banking regulations," while there's also a "zero" chance of Trump Jr. even being indicted. The source told TheDC that Trump Jr. was only indicted "for being a smart person and for being honest." While Trump Jr. was undoubtedly trying to get his father elected during the 2016 campaign, the Daily Caller noted that "it's hard to fathom why people believe he was acting on his own, when it wasn't possible or logical." The report further added that he's in "no legal jeopardy" and will remain a member of the White House staff moving forward. That's not to say this is a good thing for Team Trump. The president himself reportedly had a lot of legal, diplomatic, and political headaches that could've been prevented by knowing better about Russia than Trump and his team. Even more importantly though, in light of the numerous other investigations into the White House and Trump family members, this is yet another opportunity for the president to be held accountable.

Laravel 5.2 Laravel is an object-relational mapper for PHP. Building on the ideas of Eloquent, MySQL, and other common database tools, it's the most popular and widely-used MVC framework for PHP development. Laravel is the default PHP MVC framework, used by millions of applications. Laravel is a fully-featured, highly-concise, and fully documented yet lightweight application framework for the PHP programming language. Table of Contents Installation There are two options when installing Laravel: Install through Composer : composer global require laravel/laravel-migrations When installing Laravel through Composer, you may use the --prefer-dist option, which will install the application and its dependencies within the dist directory of the Composer package. If you prefer to install the application through the Laravel installer, use the --prefer-dist option when installing the Laravel repository instead. : Use the Laravel CLI If you're not comfortable with Composer and want to install Laravel via the Laravel CLI, run the following commands: $ php composer.phar require laravel/laravel-migrations $ php composer.phar require laravel/laravel-migrations:install $ php artisan migrate Note that after executing the above commands, your Laravel 5 installation will remain in the same location where you ran those commands. Once this process is complete, you should remove this directory from your site's public folder manually. Configuration The most important command you'll need to learn is the one that defines the database connection: app/Http/Console/Controllers/Migrations.php Use the migrate:migrate Artisan command to create and manage migrations: php artisan migrate Updating your database Updating your database is really easy! If you are using the default database schema, all we need to do is run: php artisan migrate --table="test" And that's it! Now all the updates will be created and the database table will be updated. If you are updating from a previous version of the library, you can run: php artisan migrate:upgrade If you would like to check what table is being used for the new migration, you may use this command: php artisan migrate:table You may also run this command to check what migrations are currently in progress: php artisan migrate:status Dependency Management If you are updating from the Laravel 5 installation, you will also want to make sure that the Migrate library is updated! Update your composer.json file so that the migrations dependency is updated: "composer.json": { "require": { "laravel/migrations": "~4.1" } } Publish and Publish-Subscribe Service Providers This Laravel 5 module offers a set of convenient command-line utilities, which make working with E-Commerce a breeze. Most of the functionality is provided by the public/ directory of the library. To use these utilities to make your life easier, simply place them in the public/ directory of your site. Below is a listing of the available commands that may be used to publish new E-Commerce products and products to your web store. These commands can also be used to subscribe to product information from an E-Commerce store, if you haven't already enabled this functionality: Commands Description publish Publish a new product. create Create a new product. list List all the products in your E-Commerce store. view View the list of products in your current store. delete Delete a product. subscribe Subscribe to a product for the current store. You may configure up to 5 subscriptions for a single product and up to 15 products at a time in the config/config.php file of your E-Commerce application.

In a statement, Mr. McCain said he hoped his colleagues on the Senate Foreign Relations Committee would consider his proposal and work swiftly to pass it. The measure, he said, would give "the president of the United States greater flexibility in dealing with countries where our intelligence and law enforcement agencies believe that the situation requires our continued engagement, as well as in situations where we have taken appropriate security precautions to limit the risk even further, but we could not be sure the situation posed no ongoing danger to Americans working overseas." Sign Up You will receive emails containing news content , updates and promotions from The New York Times. You may opt-out at any time. You agree to receive occasional updates and special offers for The New York Times's products and services. Thank you for subscribing. An error has occurred. Please try again later. View all New York Times newsletters. Senator Barbara A. Mikulski, Democrat of Maryland; the chairwoman of the Senate Intelligence Committee, said in a statement, "I applaud Senator McCain for coming forward with a bold, bipartisan approach to this critical issue that would provide our intelligence and law enforcement officials with additional flexibility to work where and when necessary to keep the American people and their service members safe." The bill would also give the secretary of state "the flexibility to designate certain countries where non-American citizens may be detained for the purposes of interrogation or detention, as set forth in U.S. foreign policy directives." It would also give certain counterterrorism officials the authority to detain terrorist suspects in the United States for short periods, in part to allow them to work with their local law enforcement and intelligence partners to thwart terrorism plots. The bill comes in the same week as Congress will hold its first hearings on the administration's plans to close the prison at Guantanamo Bay , Cuba , a controversial measure that is sure to be debated on the campaign trail this fall. Advertisement Continue reading the main story While there have been several congressional attempts, including an unsuccessful effort by Senator John McCain in 2005, to give the president greater latitude in setting the parameters of interrogation, no such legislation has succeeded in recent years. In a statement, the White House said it had yet to review the legislation.

Cancer Treatment Information About cancer or breast cancer Your treatment option and options depend on what stage or grade of cervical cancer you have. For more information, see stage of cancer. Cervical cancer treatment (treatment options) In North America: Most cervical cancer treatment starts with a surgical procedure. In the United States, doctors perform the majority of these procedures. Some doctors use radiation or chemotherapy instead of a surgical procedure. The type of treatment and the doctor you see depends on your stage of disease and your own circumstances. In Canada: Many cervical cancer patients in Canada get chemotherapy. A small proportion have surgery. The type of treatment and the doctor you see depends on your stage of disease and your own circumstances. Cervical cancer treatment does not usually make your life any shorter. However, there are some specific procedures, procedures, and tests that may make your life more difficult. These may affect the way you will be able to live a normal and healthy life while you are undergoing treatment. For more information about cancer, watch these videos: You can learn about the treatment you will receive, your own treatment plan, treatment options, and your recovery by downloading the information below and talking to a doctor, nurse, specialist, or registered nurse, or attending a clinic or other source of information: What does cancer mean to me? When cancer strikes, it destroys and changes your body. You might lose your hair, your voice, your strength, and your ability to do many things you used to be able to do. Most people can expect to have a good quality of life with treatment for certain types of cancer. Cancer is sometimes a life-long illness. For some cancers, it can cause death (cancers with a 10- or 90-year survival rate) or an indefinite period of illness (cancers with a 5-year survival rate) with surgery being the most effective for most cancers. For most cancers with a 5-year survival rate, the likelihood of death increases with a patient's age and with the stage of cancer (a 5-year survival rate of 20% means that one 5-year old would generally survive). The risk of dying is also increased for certain subtypes of cervical cancer or for certain types of women. Many people survive their first cancer bout. Your survival depends on many factors, and it may increase over time. For example, most women who die of cervical cancer are first diagnosed at the time of their late 40s or early 50s. If treatment is started as early as possible, most women will live or can expect to have a good quality of life. For most women whose first cancer is not diagnosed in their 40s or 50s, there is usually a 50-fold decrease in the chance of becoming a survivor. Survivors are at higher risk of developing new cancers and cancer-related complications (like death) and having additional surgeries such as hysterectomies and mastectomies. The treatment and support they receive while they are taking the medication for their cancer play an important role in their overall health as well as in their chances of recurrence, though research is still ongoing. Cancers after the first one When the first cancer is diagnosed, the chance of getting a second cancer decreases by about 30%. However, about 35%-70% of women will get a new cancer at any time in their lives, especially if they have certain high risk genetic conditions, they haven't received treatment early, and their cancer doesn't respond to treatment. The treatment for new cancers varies depending on whether the cancer is in the breast (lobular carcinoma), the neck (cervical carcinoma), or the bones (osteosarcoma). For some cancers, the surgery or chemotherapy may be different after the first cancer. Cancer before the 1st When the cancer occurs before its first stage, the chance of dying decreases. About 90% of women who survive cervical cancer are alive at 6 months after the first cancer diagnosis. If you are diagnosed with cervical cancer before its first stage and don't have certain genetic conditions, your chances of surviving are higher in certain circumstances. Your chances are better with: a pelvic exam and Pap test, if your breast or ovary has been found abnormal (biopsy) a biopsy done to check the back and the cervix, if the cancer has reached the back of your neck or the uterus (cervical spindle) more frequent Pap smear tests a biopsy done to help find and treat ovarian and bladder cancers in both women and men medication at earlier stages of the disease (for example, more chemotherapy), as well as regular Pap tests (pap and colposcopy) breast-feeding. Women who have not had a Pap test or colposcopy

When it comes to the use of social media, it can be hard to know how to be discreet and still be effective. So I thought I'd give some pointers to help you understand the difference between your typical Instagram or Twitter user and someone who is using social networking sites in a more serious manner. To start, you can't just say "I'm an Instagram user" and assume you won't get caught. But by following these steps, you can increase your chances of not getting discovered. Instagram is a free app on your mobile browser. To download, click here or go to "Apps" in your mobile browser. The easiest way to get noticed is to post a lot. This sounds obvious, but when you start posting more photos you will notice that people will stop and watch out for photos of you. There's no better way to get attention. Start a regular schedule It's easy to get caught up in the moment and only post something if it's something you like. But when you post daily, there aren't enough images of you to use in comparison to others. This will give you a more realistic image of what your followers can look past. Try to avoid taking photos when you're getting ready for a night out or getting ready for bed. If you plan to post a photo during the day, go for a more subdued photo. Don't overdo anything It's not a good idea to post something more than once a day. Even if you do post the same photo two or three times a day, it can be harder to tell if it holds anyone's attention. Instead, post more often when you're in a good mood. You'll also get more exposure if you post photos that are humorous and make fun of yourself instead of those that are serious. Don't overuse hashtags I don't use hashtags very often, but when I do I make sure to pick up on some of the popular posts and try to incorporate them into my posts. But don't try to post every 10 minutes. It's also a good idea to stick to one hashtag, such as #happy, #proud and #fave. Don't post inappropriate pictures This is tough to say for sure, but some people believe that this is the number one factor most people will follow you based on social media. I'm not a fan of this so I usually try to stay clean. Don't use photos with excessive amounts of text or too much of an impact to the view. This is one of the reasons why I only post one photo every two hours (this is a lot for some Instagram users; it just takes me a bit longer to make my photos). Don't post pics that aren't taken from the actual location where you're attending. This can be a common reason why someone gets noticed online. Don't post photos at a time when it is cold outside This was a huge one. I got a lot of attention because I posted a photo from a cold location, and I have not posted on Instagram since. Don't show your face online You wouldn't be on your phone, or even Instagram, if you were not trying to make your presence known. This will take a lot of time to build trust on social media, meaning you will definitely not get discovered. Make sure you add hashtags for you and your followers Some people don't like hashtags, so use these instead: #me (this is your username) or #yourusername It makes it very clear who you are, and who your followers are Add your Twitter name or username This helps people follow you when you add it as a username You can also add your Facebook and Google Plus accounts as well Create content that is your style When creating content for an Instagram account, I will try to create something that's specific to my interests, whether it is a photo of me riding my bike along my favorite mountain bike trail or a photo of me hiking through a field of wildflowers. Don't post anything that you're not comfortable sharing with other people This is easy to say, so I'll have to repeat myself: Don't post anything that you're not comfortable posting to people. This means your content should be personal and not out of place for your chosen platform. Don't take photos of animals or other things that can harm or attract animals There have been times where a photo that was taken with the best of intentions ended up being a huge embarrassment. People will also try to take photos of wild animals in order to get more attention. These include photos of elephants, birds, animals from nature, people, etc etc Avoid posts with words in them! If you're new to blogging and you want to get noticed on social media, I highly suggest you change the language you

GitHub, a site where programmers collaborate to develop open source software, became the most-visited site on the Internet last month, according to a new study. The report was published Thursday by the Institute for the Future, a think tank based in Silicon Valley that looks at social, technological and economic trends, and is funded by Microsoft and other tech giants. "It's sort of a little bit startling, but it does actually show how this open source platform is having a huge effect in terms of how people have adopted new technologies," said Andrew Keen, the institute's associate director. To assess how people adopt new web services, the institute looked at Alexa, which measures the number of page hits an area receives from search engines. The institute said that Alexa ranks GitHub.com No. 1 in a search for "code repositories online," with the website's traffic ranking climbing to nearly 10 million hits last month. The ranking surprised some experts. "It was really the first time any major source I'd seen came out and looked at this ranking," said Brian Solis, vice president for industry analysis with Tech Internet, a market-research firm.

This project is deprecated and has been replaced by the 'freetype2' library. The fteetothem extension lets you embed TrueType fonts contained in TeX files into LaTeX documents. The included fonts for the default version of Emacs are included in this distribution. You can find more information about fteetothem on this website and the documentation. The current version (1.0) supports the following: Emacs 24+ LaTeX 2.5 The following fonts (with a version of 1.5 or higher): This will be replaced with the 'freetype2' library during 2.5. fteetothem supports all TrueType formats. It is intended mostly for displaying fonts contained in TeX documents within Emacs. Freetype 2.0 supports TrueType fonts, but it still has some quirks. If you are using TrueType fonts with fteetothem you may still experience some issues (but if you are using TrueType fonts with Emacs's default font set (usually set by M-x load-theme ), all should be fine). If you do not meet the "TrueType fonts, Emacs" target, you can install TeX Live for TrueType fonts compatibility in this section and then use fteetothem in Emacs in the "Faster output" (see below). Installation You may install fteetothem using el-get , MELPA or via package.el directly, or you may download the latest source code and build fteetothem from source (see below). Please note that version 1.0 is based on version 1.0.2 of fteetothem . You may use version 2.0.x of fteetothem , though, if you are willing to deal with some extra work. Emacs packages In Emacs 16.x (and newer) only: If you are using version 25 or later Emacs, package-install fteetothem ; otherwise package-install fteetothem via el-get (see below for how to do this). These versions are not compatible with the older versions 1.0 of fteetothem which are based on version 1.0. ; otherwise via (see below for how to do this). These versions are not compatible with the older versions 1.0 of fteetothem which are based on version 1.0. Install via MELPA (see below) if you use el-get , or if you have MELPA 1.15 or later. MELPA packages If you aren't using version 25 or later of Emacs, MELPA packages fteetothem and fteetothem-theme (but not fteetothem-extras ): M-x package-install (but not): M-x package-install RET fteetothem RET fteetothem-theme RET You may also install fteetothem from the MELPA.org repository. To use fteetothem without installing MELPA, you can add a custom package to your load-path and then load fteetothem with M-x load-theme <RET> . Emacs 21+? Some users have had trouble with M+ . Use M-x load-theme <RET> instead. If you use Emacs 21+ you may need to add a custom variable fteetothem-custom (a string like "c:/program files (x86)/freetype/freetype.xpm" or similar). This is required for the "freetype2" plugin to be installed properly. (use-package fteetothem :ensure t ; ; custom variables fteetothem-custom ) How to use the theme The fteetothem-theme package can be configured to use the default settings for fteetothem using a key binding in the global-map . To disable fteetothem's font rendering functionality, just use the setting :font-lock-mode to disable font rendering for fteetothem . Note fteetothem-theme should not be used together with any other feature. For example using fteetothem the same way as the default font setting doesn't work, since the default font setting uses an older version of the fteetothem extension. The default colors in fteetothem-theme are defined in fteetothem.el . Caveats The default Emacs font rendering is probably not as good as one would expect. I don't know precisely how the actual font rendering works, but I've tried several solutions to try and make

Greetings all! We've been working very hard to bring together a few more things to the public in the next couple of weeks. One of which is the upcoming expansion to the "Tales of the Black Freighter" scenario. There were just too many options and components included to just release them as one big box set. It also wouldn't be fair to do all this work and then only ship them out a few more weeks. So instead we're splitting this out into a few smaller packs, to give you more options and be more fair to our backers. They'll be available on our website, or in-game via the in-game marketplace at a later date...  First up is the expansion packs...  The "Black Freighter" (1x scenario, 1x bonus/artbook, 0x expansion)  The "Greece" expansion (3x scenario, 3x bonus/artbook)  The "Lebanon" expansion (4x scenario, 4x bonus/artbook)  Lastly, the "Algeria" expansion (4x scenario, 4x bonus/artbook)  They should arrive before Christmas, if everything works out.  We'll let you know when the pre-order period for these open again!

The following interview and interview transcript is based on my conversation with Professor Steven Pinker. It will be published in The New York Times on April 10, 2006. You can read the article, or read it online at the following web site: http://www.nytimes.com/is/interview/article/0,8599,8131743,00.html

The world is awash in data, and as you may have guessed by now, data science isn't immune to the same problems that plague other fields like marketing and marketing. Many times, data that's generated by these other fields can be used by companies, but sometimes they can backfire, causing consumers to stop using specific products. For example, if a company has a relationship with a certain brand, then the brand can benefit from having good data on how their specific demographic uses its product. One such example is Google's AdSense service. When you type in a URL in Google search, you are sent an ad which includes the search term. This is done because certain keywords are often very lucrative to ad prices. A very large part of Google's revenue comes from the millions of ads which they serve on top of the normal search results. To make sure they weren't just playing favorites, AdSense has started pulling in data about this data, and then serving targeted ads to specific types of people. In other words, Google is hoping to learn the preferences and needs of its customers, so that it can predict which ads to serve based on your past behavior within the company. Advertisers have gotten in on the action, with a growing number of companies willing to place advertising within the search results, in response to this data – some of which, such as Coca-Cola and Amazon.com, are even making money off of it. But if data from any type of search is used for advertising purposes, then how is that used by companies in the industry? For example, if you are researching the most effective sunscreen for your skin, you may be shown a variety of different sunscreen brands. This is to give you a way of comparing which one would be the best for you. It goes the same for the data on your favorite drinks and foods, where companies like Nestle are getting rich from analyzing your preferences and purchasing history to predict which of their products might be most likely to be your next favorite. It's an incredibly rich field of data, and when the companies who collect it for the sake of "advertising" are looking into your history – their goal is typically to serve you products that you might not have thought of before, but that then you may be more likely to buy. "There's a tremendous amount of data on us, it's just not used for advertising-type purposes," says Nick Diener, a PhD student at University of Washington who is studying the implications of this data mining. This is a common scenario in the other "real" industries as well, and the issue is that most people are quite comfortable with giving up control over their choices – that is, until you ask them to give up control over who uses their data. "There's a difference between data that we have that's free for us to use and data that has monetary value," Diener says. In other words, Google is paying AdSense to tell them what consumers have been searching for, so that it can show them ads based on these search queries. In addition to the data in real-world products and services, we have other types of data that we have collected for many years. For example, we might have purchased a car or a computer which we now use. In that case, data about these goods can be used for advertising, because someone else has found it useful. Similarly, we might have a history of shopping on Amazon, which is in turn used to track whether or not customers are likely to purchase our items. This type of data, while useful, can also be potentially dangerous, as it can allow a single person to effectively control the entire market. If you aren't careful, though, even your own data could be used, to the detriment of those less fortunate than you. "If I'm the owner of data about my health, I want someone who's trying to create a device like this to know that they can't have this data taken – they know the data is valuable, and they're trying to use it for good," says Diener. According to Diener, his research will show to people that "you can use these data in a number of different ways, but the most common is just to make stuff. You can use data, for instance about who you're likely to turn to in an emergency – you can use it for the purposes of marketing, by saying that your health issues, which might be a problem with a heart condition or something, could be solved by this device you're looking at. You could use it in a lot of ways that I think are unethical." Unfortunately, such abuses aren't likely to stop with Google, as all of the data that companies collect has now opened up a Pandora's Box of potential abuses. According to Diener, data mining "is a form of economic blackmail of its members." The data collected by this "economies of scale" can be used to

Fernando Velasco-Mesquita will begin a seven-day trial in Barcelona on Friday morning, as he continues to recover from a dislocated shoulder that cost the Spaniard a chance at the 2014 season-opener. Velasco-Mesquita suffered the injury on training at the start of training on Tuesday and a full rehabilitation will take until November, leading him to miss the Spanish round, which brings the WorldTour into force. However, Velasco-Mesquita is now in line to return to racing – and potentially a podium finish - for the Clasica San Sebastian in September. Velasco-Mesquita was one of the few Spaniards on the start grid at Tour De France Velasco-Mesquita, who also won the Spanish national road race championships in April and May, suffered an ankle injury which ruled him out of last Sunday's second stage of the Vuelta a Espana – and he will need to undergo an ankle adjustment before participating in the Clasica. "The injury will take a month to heal, so I need to do as much rehabilitation as possible to get myself ready for the Clasica," Velasco-Mesquita said. "This is not a big problem, but when I started training again I was unable to do much because of pain. So I am just happy to get out on the bike again. Even if it's not an easy course there will be a lot of chances to do well. "I am fully aware I have a difficult road ahead, but what matters most to me is that I'm still able to compete and start the season with a win." The trial will not be the first time Velasco-Mesquita takes part in the Spanish race, as he finished ninth at the inaugural edition in 2013. "In the end I think it was only a few seconds that separated me from the top, after the climb and the technical descent. I tried to push my limits and go for a stage win but it wasn't to be, so I had to settle for seventh," he recalled. After recovering from his injury last year, Velasco-Mesquita went on to take second overall at the U23 Giro del Trentino, which brought the UCI WorldTour into being, and the 23-year-old hopes to do the same at Tour de France level at the weekend. "I also have a feeling that I will be here, fighting for the win against the best UCI pro riders," Velasco-Mesquita said. "I'm already feeling that way, but in reality the race is a long way from here, I still believe in myself and I'm going to try my luck." Full press conference transcript:

An 18-year-old boy shot six times during a street fight with another kid has died, police said. The shooting happened at 6:40 p.m. Tuesday at the corner of West 47th and Wabash streets in South Side Park, according to Chicago police. Witnesses told police the first shots were fired when six teens got out of a van that had been stopped at a red light. They then proceeded to fight and shots were fired as they ran, police said in a statement. Two of the teens were struck and taken to Advocate Illinois Masonic Medical Center, where they're being treated. The other teens were hit in the arm and the abdomen, police said. One of three suspects was arrested at the scene, said Officer Jose Estrada, a Chicago police spokesman. His name hasn't been released, but officials said he was 18 years old. There was no information on any of the teens' conditions Wednesday afternoon.

I really don't understand this: "The reason I don't take pictures with people is to protect myself from people I don't know. I would never, ever take your picture if it wasn't safe to take. I'm not interested in meeting anyone, and most people are too."  What? So even if you're not interested in meeting the person in the photo, you're still fine with them knowing it? Like this is something that really bothered you? "I don't take pictures with people. It's so I can protect myself if people I don't know approach me in a bad way. For that reason, I tend to avoid photographing any kind of situations where there are strangers or acquaintances who are not involved in the conversation." (source) You're making it seem like everyone else is wrong when they actually were just protecting themselves. Like when someone makes rude comments on a public sidewalk, but you'll just shrug it off and continue staring at that pretty girl you saw on the subway.  If the person isn't bothering you for some reason then you shouldn't even be on their radar, let alone take their picture without consent.  So what am I supposed to do? If they're taking my picture without asking, why should I be okay with that?

SACRAMENTO, Calif. (Reuters) - U.S. President Donald Trump will use the state-of-the-union address to attack China, and "deter them from taking advantage of America's weaknesses with a currency manipulator," a top Republican from California said on Thursday. U.S. President Donald Trump speaks as Education Secretary-designate Betsy DeVos (L) looks on during a meeting with (from left) U.S. Vice President Mike Pence, Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell (R-KY), Senate Democratic Leader Chuck Schumer and House Majority Leader Kevin McCarthy (2nd L) at the White House in Washington, U.S., February 9, 2017. REUTERS/Kevin Lamarque California's Governor Jerry Brown and other Democrats have made clear they will target Trump's potential tax reform push at businesses moving operations overseas, saying those moves have cost U.S. jobs, prompting Trump to attack Democrats specifically last weekend. In his 2016 election campaign, Trump threatened to slap higher tariffs on Chinese goods than he would on imports from other countries, although he has not specified what changes he might make to deal with a trade imbalance with China. "You are going to see California's president address that," said California Democratic Representative Adam Schiff, a close ally of Senate Democratic Leader Chuck Schumer of New York. "It will be in stark, stark contrast to anything that president Trump will say." Schiff did not rule out a new tax on China, but he said Trump would be "trying to get China to engage in a bilateral discussion" without Congress. House Republican Bill Flores dismissed criticism of the president being too negative, saying Democrats wanted to paint Trump in a bad light during his speech. Trump has said his administration has accomplished more in a few months than most presidents in their first year. Democrats, who boycotted the 2011 State of the Union address after former Republican President George Bush used his speech to criticize former Democratic President Barack Obama without mentioning him. The White House said on Thursday Trump planned to unveil a new immigration proposal late next month. It did not cite details of what plan would call for but Trump met with business leaders over the weekend and could use the meeting to outline a more comprehensive immigration policy. Trump had been expected to roll out a more sweeping border security plan after he secured the support of conservative lawmakers and the Republican Study Committee. He has also suggested he may expand the war against Islamic State militants with the new immigration plan. California already requires foreign buyers of new homes to obtain a buyer's permit and has required local agencies to report a backlog of transactions. It also banned people with criminal records from buying a home. Brown said in an interview on Thursday he was pleased that Trump had asked the Pentagon and the Department of Homeland Security to take action on the problem of illegal immigrants who have been convicted of crime. "We're getting some good news, but we can't have all of these illegal immigrants buying homes, especially in a state like California that wants to preserve and promote homeownership," he said. A poll released by the University of California Center for Political Studies said Californians' support for legal immigration, which has long been a big issue in the state's politics, was dropping. Forty-five percent of Californians said immigrants helped the state economically, down from 57 percent last year.

PURPOSE: The purpose of this study was to examine the efficacy of four treatment strategies for non‐malignant (included in the definition of breast cancer) breast carcinoma in women with an existing diagnosis at a tertiary centre. METHODS: This is a non‐randomised, controlled, crossover trial. Women ≥ 20 years old recruited by advertising were randomly assigned to three sessions comprising of two and four treatments; all subjects were assessed pre‐ and post‐treatment based on clinical response. RESULTS: Over the course of the intervention, 48 subjects were assessed in two sessions. Twenty‐six subjects (53%) in the two‐ and four‐session groups achieved clinical response. Six subjects (11%) did not achieve response after two sessions while eight subjects (21%) in the two‐session group and eight subjects (17%) in the four‐session group achieved non‐response. The two‐ and four‐session groups had statistically significant improvements in the incidence of all breast tumours (relative risk (RR) 2.06, 95% confidence interval (CI) 1.40-3.33 and 1.28, 95% CI .72-.84 respectively), in the grade 4/5 breast tumours (RR 3.14, 95% CI 1.44-6.00 and 1.17, 95% CI .63-.94 respectively), and in the grade 0/1 breast cells (RR 10.06, 95% CI 1.32-48.6 and 4.39, 95% CI .38-.96 respectively) by three months after the intervention, compared with the baseline. CONCLUSIONS: The two and four‐session approaches to the management of this disease demonstrate a significant ability to improve the outcomes of patients and are well tolerated. Clinical efficacy with the four‐session approach is similar to that of two‐ and three‐session approaches, and represents a significant advance in the management of this disease in women.

A woman accused of leaving her two young sons at a church in Fort Lauderdale, Fla., was charged with four counts of child abandonment Friday, police said. Carolyn Toney, 49, and her sons, 8-year-old James and 9-year-old John, had gone to church at 8 a.m. Thursday, police spokesman Alvaro Zabaleta said. When they arrived, her sons were outside their bedroom door, with only a blanket in between them. Toney told police the boys had gone hungry for an entire school day, so she made up a meal that she put on the table in their room, Zabaleta said. The boys' parents, who were not identified, were in the church during the meal, and they got hungry as well, Toney told police. According to a statement from police, the children, who remain at the home with Toney and her children's uncle, had not eaten their breakfast, lunch or dinner. At 1:30 p.m. Friday morning, Toney allegedly showed up at the home with her 3-year-old son and handed him two pieces of food and then left to go to Wal-Mart with a 12-year-old daughter. When Toney didn't return home until 4:30 p.m., police responded to her home at 1225 East Fort Lauderdale Road, where they found her son and daughter, who were eating a pizza. The boy's father had left at 1:30 p.m. and the family hadn't eaten their dinner since they got to church, police said. The children's uncle was also at the scene and told police that he had called the church to see what was going on before going upstairs and hearing that Toney had left her kids at the church. The uncle also told police that Toney was not wearing a jacket or scarf on Thursday and that she had not asked him to take care of the boys. An officer later took the child's picture on a poster board and then took a picture of her before placing it into evidence, police said. Toney will be arraigned on Friday afternoon at 9 a.m.
